The Food ist very Delicious and the Atmosphere is very nice. You feels like in a small Restaurant in Spain.

Lovely food, well cooked.
Buffalo excellent
Chicken very good
One complaint make sure they warm the plates before serving, cold plates are not good.

We had dinner our dinner here. We ordered almost all the food available in the menu!
Food was great! We all enjoyed the food. Unfortunately some of the food in the menu are unavailable. I hope it will be available in our next visit. â˜ºï¸

This is one of the best restaurants in Quy Nhon I have found so far. The restaurant is decorated so nice, with a lovely garden. And the food is very delicious with a huge portion (Not the size of the tapas and so good for the price). Ah, and I love my Apple Wishkey Sour cocktail, too.

We came here being huge Spanish tapas lovers and we were so so impressed with the incredible quality of every single dish we tried. The staff were incredibly helpful and so friendly, we were made to feel super welcome. I honestly think this is the best tapas I've ever ate in any country not just vietnam. The absolute star of the show was the Garlic Prawn dish which was served with the most delicious fresh homemade bread. It was just unreal how tasty it was. I think its the best dish I've ever ate hand down. If you come here you must try this dish no matter what. It was also very reasonably priced and we couldn't quite believe how little it cost us for what we ate when you considered the high quality of the dishes. It was by far my favourite restaurant in the whole of Quy Nhon.
The best place in the city, highly recommended, very tasty food, good atmosphere and top notch service â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

Great food, perfect atmosphere, fun music, creative drinks menu, warm young owners who know and love what they are doing, what more to ask for?

Hai Rom is slowly becoming my favorite restaurant in Quy Nhon that serves Western food. Tried half the menu and so far havenâ€™t been disappointed. The eggplant dip, garlic prawn and tuna tataki in particular are not to be missed.

Another thing that makes Hai Rom stand out for me is the vibe and atmosphere that its owners have curated. Low key, chill, cozy, can be very romantic if you want it to be. The mostly outdoor courtyard setting is also a rarity in the city, for sure.

All in all, highly recommended for anyone visiting or staying in Quy Nhon.

Keep up the amazing work, guys!

My favorite restaurant in Quynhon. They have such a good quality, yummy and beautiful dishes. They also play really good music. Perfect for romantic dinner for couples, for family and friends. Absolutely love this place. Owners will make you feel so comfy

The owner and his wife are extremely friendly. Speak English well and the food must use excellent words. For me, a person living in Quy Nhon, this restaurant is the best when cooking western dishes. Well trained chef. And when he eats his food, he will feel the love he puts in his food.

I'm from Spain and I was blown away by the delicious food; it's a very original vietnamese interpretation of spanish tapas. The owners are a really friendly couple and there's a very cozy atmosphere, with good music and tasteful decoration. The prices are cheap too! I can't recommend this place enough. This is my first time commenting here precisely because it was such a pleasant experience and I feel like they deserve all the publicity they can get. Make sure to check it out if you're a foody visiting Quy Nhon.

Para los espaÃ±oles:
Si buscÃ¡is el tÃ­pico bar de tapas patrio, mejor quedaros en EspaÃ±a, pero si querÃ©is comida sabrosa de calidad en un buen ambiente, Â¡no busquÃ©is mÃ¡s! Tienen croquetas, gazpacho y muchos otros platos espaÃ±oles pero, por lo general, con un toque muy original del chef, que es vietnamita. Todo es muy fresco, con verduras y frutas de temporada; hasta tienen plantitas de romero, de pimiento y mÃ¡s cosas en la entrada/zona exterior. A mÃ­ me pareciÃ³ absolutamente delicioso todo lo que probÃ©, y ademÃ¡s el sitio es sÃºper agradable, decorado con buen gusto, muy acogedor, con buena mÃºsica y la camarera, que es la mujer del dueÃ±o, era encantadora. Un sitio totalmente recomendable.

A short ride from Quy Nhon. Well worth the trip. like eating in someone's home only a small sign gives it away. The food was amazing and really good value. And the service was excellent. After a hot day exploring the village and beach the ice cold beers in frozen glasses really hit the spot. If you are looking for somewhere authentic and non touristy that serves great local food this is the place.

The cafe is set in a small fishing village right next to beautiful beaches.we stayed at a local guest house ( the haven) who told us where to go and glad they did..we had chicken with lemongrass which was so good, pumpkin soup and morning glory, all fresh and tasty...and def served with the warmest smiles.they also sell some local crafts, def well worth visiting, what better way to spend the day, delicious food, awesome beaches and massages if you want too. :)

We where recommended to try this cafe by our lovely hosts at the Haven guesthouse .
Wow, what a surprise !!!!!
Not the typical cafe entrance nor decor, but worth the visit . We will eat there again for sure while we stay in the area.
The food was wholesome and delicious , not to mention the friendly smile that we where greeted with , plus the sincere gratitude shown for visiting this little local business.
Loved it!!!!!!

We live close by and wee happy to hear there was a little cafe opening in nearby Bai Xep. It's worth the 20 minute bus ride on the T9 from town or you can taxi for under 10$. They have a set menu, you sit down and out comes the food. Generous serves of delicious home cooked Vietnamese food! After such a big meal it's nice to walk down through the little village and swim off the calories at the beautiful beach. This is a treasure of a place!

I was exploring this small fishing village of the beaten path and came upon a small cafe-house that simply offered "lunch/dinner" and a few other options on a whiteboard.

Being that my other options were rice pancakes and hot soup in the village, i decided to give it a try with 2 other friends.

We were greeted with a smile and told of the menu of the day, a preset meal that changes daily, which on our day consisted of a chicken dish/spring rolls/rice/vegetables/soup, all for $5

We received a pumpkin soup with enoki mushrooms in a chicken stock, a yellow curried chicken dish, homemade baby spring rolls, and a stir fried cabbage, rice was included too.

So all in all a 4 course meal made to order for $5! It will surely cure your hunger and make sure you save room for the ice cream! If feeling daring ask for the durian surprise flavor!!!

They also sell a few gift items that you can take as a keepsake of your visit to this tiny village.

If you are lucky you can practice some English or Vn with Ms Mi or Ms Ni over the ice cream!

If you happen to be locked up in the soulless city of Quy Nhon, head to this heavenly coffee house, for the best pancakes, coffees and other sweets and healthy juices. A beautifully designed indoor with charming front garden with swing bench, some jazz music turn this place in a heaven.

Went there in the evening and the following morning and really enjoyed. Great atmosphere, great food and they have a pool table which is a bonus!

Dong is in a back street area serving fresh seafood. It is popular with locals so we followed the crowd and were not disappointed. When in a new area it is smart to watch where the locals eat and follow their lead.

When I'm in Quy Nhon I always visit Dong's as well as Seafood 2000 which is right around the corner. Great selection of fresh seafood at both though Dong has the advantage o a sea view from its outside tables.

We ordered the steamed red snapper which was succulent. Fresh calamari, steamed not fried and noodles with shrimp. All of it was top notch. Total bill for 3 people was 450,000 Dong or about $23 US. Always ask to see the fish if you're paying by the kilo and have them weigh it in front of you. This is SOP in Vietnamese seafood eateries.

Bring mosquito repellent if you decide to sit outside. They're ankle biters.

Very disappointing experience. English menu at the back with prices in USD so think there is x 2 tiered pricing for locals v's tourists. The calamari wasn't calamari - like eating rubber tyre with as much flavour and texture plus US$6 expensive by local standards. Very unimpressed.

We stopped here for a quick late night bite after our arrival in Quy Nhon. Mr Dong, at least, that is what we called him was great. We actually ate here twice. What wasn't available the first night was available the second night.
The shrimps, clams and other seafood was perfectly fresh and prepared on the spot. Together with a few cold beers this made for one of our nicest Vietnamese dinner experience, simply because Quy Nhon sees few tourists so you eat with the local.

Dining a Dong was an experience. Ironically, the English menu didn't list the prices in Dong, but in USD, which is annoying, but apart from that the menu was easy to read and there was one waiter who spoke a little English.
The food was a little oily but it tasted good, I wouldn't go back in a hurry, but I'm glad I tried it.

I've been here several times. I cannot get enough of the sauce the put on the fried chicken. It's a flavor i haven't had anywhere in Vietnam yet. An amazing mixture of American style Bbq sauce and Asian spice. I wish i could get the recipe.
it was nice to seat that the beach in-front of you, drinking several drinks like coffee or juice . It little crowded out side because of the motorbikes traffic.

We came across this cafe randomly during a long walk. It was an oasis within in a dearth of familiar-looking, comfortable places to sit down in.
Non english speaking staff, but big, friendly welcome, great lime juice drink, and good views of the beachfront upstairs. Clean and wonderful.

This is our daily trip to a good coffee. Location is very nicely decorated with extremely friendly staff. Every time we come we are welcomed with a hearty smile. Thank you for your extraordinary hospitality, we will return as long as we stay in Qui Nohn.

Lovely friendly owner, as described in previous reviews. It's a kind of buffet where you can ask for the various things in the glass cabinet to be added to your plate, so no surprises when the food gets to you!! Two of us had a full meal and a beer each for 130,000 dong. Bargain.

I came here for quick food based on the previous review and have to say that this place is great - owner is genuinely friendly to tourists, speaks good English and the price is amazing - I had beer and a HEAP of food for 60k VND. Combined with the atmosphere I wish I found this place sooner!

The food is exc and huge selection, the other attraction is the owner, who loves tourists and speaks english, wants to show you around town and see to it that you meet people and have fun. Support small family run enterprises by going here, you wont be sorry.

Wir sind mehr zufÃ¤llig auf dieses Restaurant gestoÃŸen. Obwohl sie schon abbauten, lud uns der Besitzer noch in den Laden ein. Es gab eine groÃŸe Auswahl an vietnamesichen Speisen (Fleisch, Fisch, Tofu, GemÃ¼se). Der Besitzer leistete uns Gesellschaft am Tisch. Es herrschte eine entspannte und familiÃ¤re Stimmung. Es war ein gelungener Abend. Wir empfehlen diesem kleinen, einfachen Restaurant unbedingt einen Besuch abzustatten!

I had great time with my fanily here. The food was good especially grill chicken. Also the atmosphete was great for family dining!

Thank You TripAdvisor for approving my request for this restaurant listing. It is a very fantastic restaurant that I wish to share with more people to try it.

This is the all-day dining restaurant located in Zone 1 of FLC Luxury Hotel Quy Nhon. We dined here almost everyday during our stay from Dec 19-24. Food and service are really superb, that we only dined twice at an Italian restaurant at Quy Nhon city.

Special thanks to Ms. Phuong Nguyen whom we met most of the days during our stay. She speaks very good English and with her around, our orders never went wrong.

Morning breakfast:
Buffet style from 6-10am daily. From 0800am onwards the dining hall is fully packed, so come early to avoid the crowd. Many varieties of food including live stations of Pho and Eggs and hot dishes like stir fried beef, vege, vermicelli, sticky rice (our favorite), etc. There is also bread, cheese, yoghurt, waffles and pancakes, as well as cut fruits, salads, fruit juices, cereals, milk, coffee and tea.

Lunch/dinner ala carte:
There are both western and Vietnamese dishes available on their extensive menus.
Daily set menu (Vietnamese) is also available that comes with a free beer/soft drinks/juice.
Our favorites are Garden salad, Beef tenderloin, Vietnamese fish soup, Stir fried noodle, and Vanilla Ice Cream.
There is also an ongoing Winter Hot Pot and beverage promo, buy 2 get 1 drinks for beer, soft drinks and selected fresh juices.

Dinner buffet:
Available on weekends during our stay, Dec 21 & 22. We did not try but saw there were a lot of varieties.

Such a cool craft beer bar, they had a huge selection to choose from. I tried the fruity IPA it was delicious. Very friendly staff too. It's funky venue with some great artwork. The food menu was plentiful too but I didn't get round to trying anything. I will definitely return here if I ever come back to Quy Nhon.

What a Unique little taproom. A very nice place in Quy Nhon that serves a very good selection of craft beer (including draft beer on-tap) and great food at reasonable prices. The beer selection will satisfy a wide range of beer lovers. The setting is lovely and staff are very friendly. Highly recommended for beer enthusiasts
Fruity IPA - draft beer on-tap is a "must try"
I highly recommend this place for the beer lovers or to those who are curious. Hawaiian pale ale is a "must try". Great atmosphere and good staff.

Fantastic little bar, Well worth a visit
Good selection of beers and friendly staff. Will certainly return

We orderd steam squid & ginger, it was tasteless, also had fried noodles with cabbage there was no cabbage in meal, the noodles where instant like 1 minute noodles from Maggie & I'm still tasting the oil 2 hours later, also ordered fried rice with egg it was the better dish of all 3 but still below average. Every ones taste is different but it wasn't to mine but go ahead & try & make up your own mind. Also they couldn't speak any English lucky the menu was in English & you point to the dish you want. Oh & don't expect a cold beer it's only served hot with a glass of ice.

Had to come back to this lovely spot during our visit to Quy Nhon. Amazing, authentic spanish tapas, lovely homely environment with a beautiful pup. Staff were so friendly and attentive we felt at home instantly. Highly recommend!

A friendly aspect restaurant from outside but as soon You are seated, an air of estrangement to the place assails you due to, a detached attitude of the staff.
Interesting idea , the use of portable Japanese made table cooking grill but , quality of fish , in our case squid , very low compared also with price .
They serve vegetable as accompanying plate , on routine base , without ask You any opinion and at the end You found on the bill separated as new voice.

Ordered the grilled clams, grilled squid, and steamed crabs. The crabs were tasty but the other dishes were inedible. The clams were so over cooked that they were very very very chewy. The squid was overly charred causing it to be extremely bitter with an acrid aftertaste.

Bong Benh, a family-owned seafood restaurant, is a must go.

Being new to the tourist route in Quy Nhon, the hot local fav, is reasonably priced with a huge array of fresh seafood.

Google translate (with audio) is a MUST though! Am missing the Aunty/owner there whom, upon realising that we could converse with them using Google, was extremely warm and friendly and even gave me a tight hug before we left

Iâ€™ve been here several times with family & friends for family gathering & meeting friends. They have a great array of food to choose from & they are very good. My sonâ€™s favorite is the Iron Beef. Must try when you are in Quy Nhon.

I ate at this restaurant while visiting quy nhon. I was staying at 5 elements so I was able to try multiple dishes (tacos, chimichanga, mexican burger, and tuna salad). All of which are very solid!! If youre looking for a high quality burger, or craving mexican food, they will get you sorted. The mexican burger, and salsa are my favorite and the salsa in particular taste like authentic mexican flavor. DEFINITELY WORTH THE VISIT
Been in Quy Nhon diving at Alpha dive Vieynam and been stay at 5 elements Garden. The burgers and Taco are the finest in this town its must have

Bogosov at 5 Elements Garden in Quy Nhon is a very nice place to eat.

Fresh, delicious and affordable.

My personal favorite: The Mexican Burger

But tacos, steaks and tuna salad are also recommended.

Ask for a Tequila shot from the gun...

This is an excellent local Vietnam noodle soups with fish. The food was very good and the service was excellent. The staff explain us the way to prepare the sauce. It was one of the best noodle soup I eat in Vietnam.

Walked past this place while looking for another restaurant.
It looked good, had lots of locals eating and getting take away.

No chance of English menus or anyone speaking English.
However the staff where very friendly towards us.

Ended up with a noodle soup unsure what meat was in this but I think it may of been tongue or some other offal. (Not quite sure to be honest)
Noodles where round vs the flat white noodles I have seen elsewhere
Came with a side of herbs , bean sprouts and chilli.

We also got some rice paper rolls.
They where bigger than expected but tasted amazing.
Stuffed with herbs, vedgi meat and something else that was crunchy. (not sure what)
Served with a spicy but fruity dip.
Best rice paper rolls I have had yet. (Not that I have had a lot)

Price was good. I would go back it was one of the better noodle's I had in Ho Chi Minh City.

Toi cam thay than thien vo cung khi buoc chan den khach san Lotte. Mac du gia dinh toi chi ghe qua khach san de an toi o tang 36 tai nha hang Timhowan.
Dieu khien gia dinh toi thay rat vui va muon quay tro lai noi nay moi cuoi tuan vi mot dieu rat don gian nhung lai cam thay duoc tran trong.
Nhan vien don chao rat chuyen va nhiet tinh, luon giup do voi nu cuoi tuoi tan. Tiep tuc len nha hang thi lai duoc tiep don voi man chao hoi cua cac ban dung cua rat nhiet tinh va nho ten khach rat gioi.
Mac du gd toi moi chi den nha hang khoang 4 lan ma chung toi rat an tuong voi cac ban o day.
Khong nhung canh dep co the ngam nhin Ho Tay tron ven va canh dep cua Ha Noi that tuyet voi ma do an o day rat ngon, gia ca thi rat hop ly voi tui tien cua gd toi.
Hai con trai cua toi rat thich den noi nay boi cac ban duoc dua vui nhu o nha va duoc cac co phuc vu chu dao quan tam den cac chau.
Chinh vi the gd toi cam thay rat hai long ve noi nay. Va chac rang chung toi se den day thuong xuyen

I went to meet a friend at this restaurant in early May 2022 and it it closed per a tenant in the strip shopping mall at this address. In its place is a restaurant called Momoyama Ramen & Hawaiian BBQ.

Of all places to find this restaurant, one would not expect it to reside in a strip shopping center. Regardless, this is a great little place. The tofu appetizer was spectacular.
So was the seafood medley entree. Their dishes have unique flavors and textures. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed.
Above average Thai - Veitnames fair at super reasonable priced. The sauces are to die for. Specials hit the mark. Especially like the Seafood Meledy with pinnapple yellow curry. Yum

This restaurant doesn't get enough press. Having been there some years ago, a friend suggested it for lunch this week. It was great. First rate service in a good venue set the ambiance. The food was worth the trip. Excellent soup(s) and main dishes were truly appreciated. Fairly priced, which is not easy to find these days. Highly recommended.
You will find an interesting variety of Asian foods on their menu. The sampler appetizer plates are very good. We shared the vegetarian and seafood plates. Entres were well sized.

What an inspired NYE choice; Thai-French-Indian fusion for that windy-rainy night.

The food is simply excellent. A small menu with descriptions that cry 'choose me', so I had the yellow chicken curry and she had the French beef dinner. The dumpling platter for our shared starter.

The waitstaff is excellent; our lady has been there since their opening 6+ years ago, Clean facilities, no language issues; they're just nice people who run one of the nicest restaurants in the area. Go and enjoy!

Our meal started with a great appetizer, the vegetable sampler. All four items included in it were delicious. I was patting myself on the back for a great choice of restaurants on our vacation. Then things went downhill. I asked my waitress to make my chicken and cashew main course with less spice as I have reflux. The dish was served spicy. Not wanted to wait for a new one to be made I soldiered on. I gave up after several bites and left the rest.
The owner came over and told our new waitress who was very sweet how it should have been ordered and apologized to us offering us a dessert on the house. Ah but no dessert menu came, just a check. No adjustment made to the check either.
I think this has the potential to have been a very good restaurant but I came away still hungry. Nice people but they handled this wrong.

This beautiful little bistro offers a French Asian menu starring freshness & flavor at reasonable prices. Located only minutes away from the large shopping mall, Colonial Quy-Bau offers an oasis of relaxed dining. We tend to stick w/ favorites & we did so at this meal - his choice for an appetizer Grilled Chicken Satay w/ peanut sauce (flavorful, moist & delicious); my choice for an app was their wonderful Golden Bags (5 crispy pouches filled w/ shrimp & crabmeat, served over a sweet chilies sauce)...yum, yum, yum! For dinner entrees, my husband opted for their Brick-Roasted Crispy Duck served w/ a Blueberry Chambord Glaze w/ scalloped potatoes & broccoli - so good! I selected Shrimp Pad Tai - equally delicious. An excellent meal indeed.

I donâ€™t know why there isnâ€™t a line at the door here every day. This is superb food, deliciously prepared, great variety - French Vietnamese theme, responsive service, delightful dining experience. Rack of lamb and seafood medley with rice noodles tonight, delicious, repeat visits inevitable!
This is a wonderful place! Excellent food, attentive service at reasonable prices. Itâ€™s a hidden gem.

Been there many times. Superb food carefully and artistically prepared by chef/owner. His credentials are unbelievable and the food is worth the wait if you have to wait. Fridays and Saturdays are crowded (with good reason). This small restaurant in an unimpressive strip mall at the northwest corner of PA routes 611 and 63 is absolutely a hidden jewel.

First time there. It is in a strip mall, but once you enter the decor makes you feel like you are in a fine eating establishment. The waiter was excellent and helpful in suggesting a variety of dishes to try.

An incredible restaurant, city quality in the suburbs. You can choose between a VERY affordable menu of Vietnamses classics like Pho, Bun, and Com, or a pricey menu of French cuisine, or a menu of fusion items with prices everywhere in between. Very fanc y atmosphere, great service, and a knowledgeable and passionate owner/head chef. Always a delight, just try for anyone in the are.

This is a great location for lunch. The quaint surrounding and personal touch provided by the chef for each meal make it truly unique. The chef even often comes out to talk to diners. Definitely a must try.

This place has the BEST food ever! It is French-Vietnamese . The house fried rice is to die for. The crispy duck delicious! And you must have the Vietnamese iced coffee. Soooo good! You must try this restaurant . Chef Cory is the best!!!!!

This was a recommendation from a family member that goes here on a regular basis. I'm not always in the mood for this type of offering, but I was thrilled with the diverse menu when I got there. The appetizers were good (Chicken Satay and golden bags were amazing) the dinner was even better. If I had one complaint it was that the Veal Chop and the Rack of Lamb were slightly more done than the medium rare we requested. Yet both entrees were still tender and seasoned well. The waitstaff was fine and overall the price more than fair. We will come back.
Good food and very informative hostess, she explained each and every item in the menu we asked about. Service was fast. Good place to dine over all
Excellent specials, fabulous standard menu. Asian fusion, very fresh. Will also prepare to taste. Quite delicious.
Four of us had a variety of appetizers, soups, and entrees. The 2 Veg rolls were thin. My wife said that the "crispy" duck wasn't crispy, and was 'tasteless'. The soup and seafood were good.

Excellent Asian Vietnamese cuisine. AAA+ dÃ©cor,
nice cozy atmosphere, also good for a romantic date.
no liquor, byob!! Seafood sampler awesome.
service a bit slow and can be improved!

Met friends in mid way point between Robbinsville NJ and Exton PA and this was the restaurant I chose. Sight unseen, just pulled it up on google..and what a fantastic place it was. We were there for lunch, and it was wonderful. The food was outrageously delicious so I can only imagine how good dinner would be. a BYOB place made it even better. Staff was helpful in picking dishes..If I lived near this area I would be there every night. Asian Fusion with French and I don't know what else but an extraordinary combination.

Bring a bottle of wine. The food is outstanding and they have several specials. The seafood was great and service was excellent. The price was just right. Don't let the storefront fool you, this is quality.

We went to Colonial Quy Bau to celebrate our wedding anniversary with our family on a Saturday evening. We were seated promptly and a waitress arrived within a reasonable amount of time to take our order. That is where the service ended. We waited and waited and waited for more than an hour and our food never arrived. We mentioned to our waitress that people arriving long after us were being served their meal and wondered what happened to our food.She kept making some stupid excuses. Finally I told her that if our food was not served within the next 5-10 minutes, we were leaving. Shortly after that our food started to arrive in piece meal, not altogether. Food was fair. Certainly not worth the wait. We finally found out that they lost our order ticket. They tried to compensate by bringing 1 free appetizer while we waited, and they did give all of us free desert. The chef also made an appearance at our table to apologize which was very nice of him. We definitely will not be going back.

Went for an early dinner with family on a Monday. My family likes Vietnamese food and this was the closest one we could find open on a Monday. We were first given menus featuring the French and American with some Asian dishes, particularly Thai. The specials were also in this category. We were given Vietnamese food menus only after we specifically asked. This was a less expensive menu. Perhaps that is why it is not volunteered when you are first seated. The other menu wasn't overpriced for the type of food. There were items I would be happy to try in the future. But on this day we were there for Vietnamese food. We had a variety of dishes, including pho. All were tasty, including the Oreo cake we had for dessert. The restaurant was very pleasant. Not noisy or smokey when we were there. So yes, I would recommend this restaurant for the Asian food and would certainly try something off the other menu. I understand not everyone loves Vietnamese food as much as my family. The variety and choice is a plus as long as you know there are 2 menus.

One of the best Thai-French-Asian restaurants in the area! They also serve Vietnamese dishes, plus the best steaks and chops you've ever had!! Everything on the menu is absolutely fantastic and the service is awesome, like a 5 star French restaurant! Go here once and I guarantee you'll come back 1,000 times...it's that good!

Came here with a friend based on their review. We arrived around lunch time on a Saturday. The place was not too busy and we got seated immediately. We shared two appetizers. The fried tofu salad was actually very tasty with the right amount of acidity in the dressing. It was very enjoyable. The fried Quy-Bau was also very good. They were basically made of meaty filling wrapped in wonton sheet and deep fried. They came out very crispy which was very enjoyable.
There are two menus -- one traditional Vietnamese menu where you can find things like Bum and Pho. There is also a menu with 'French influence', where the food is a bit fancier (by plating) with a higher price. I had the mixed seafood dish with noddle and my friend had the pad Thai noddle. We both agreed that the food was tasty but we were not really sure where the French influence came from. Maybe it's the plating?
Everything is a three star -- meets expectation.

We were seated towards the back of the small restaurant at around 5:30 PM on a Saturday night. We ordered portabella mushroom and leek steamed dumplings first. The dumplings were actually very bland and seemed as though they were not made in-house because the dumpling was too perfect or perhaps a dumpling mold was used to form the outer casing. Regardless they were bland. Next my partner ordered the Wok Chili Tenderloin of Beef (well done) his mistake with white rice. The beef was terribly over-done, tough in fact. He powered through it though since he did not have any of the dumplings after the first one. I had the Amish Chicken with River Rice Noodles. The dishes were okay but not great and not great enough to justify the price for the tenderloin at $23. The worst part of the meal and the reason for the review was two issues. One, someone in the kitchen or out back beyond the kitchen was smoking and the smoke leeched into the dining room during our meal. We lost our appetite frankly. How the wait staff did not notice was beyond us since they were setting up with glassware etc. in a corner area blocked off with a screen to the right of us. Second, they were also very loud and could be heard during our meal. Why they were setting up tables while people were dining was beyond me. The appetizer came out quickly which we appreciated however our entrees came out minutes after the appetizer came out and no sooner did I have the last dumpling in my mouth then the entrees arrived. The wait person was attentive and so was the other staff BUT they were really loud, I was disappointed that the items on the lunch menu were not on the dinner menu such as the Pho. I should have asked if they could prepare the Pho since that was what I was looking to order. We left honestly disgusted primarily because of the tobacco smoke smell that filled the dining room. I did mention that to the wait staff on the way out. Sorry but we shall not return.

We ate here twice before, having great food and good service. Went here on Labor Day. We made reservations. No one wrote them down but the host remembered our call. We waited ten minutes to be seated (there were several empty tables), another 20 minutes for our order to be taken and then - nothing. We sat for an hour and fifteen minutes with no food and no explanation. We finally got up and left.
We shall never go back.

This is a small byob in a shopping center and is absolutely wonderful! The food was excellent and the service was the same. They take reservations. The night we were there it was a little loud as there was a large table next to us. I will definitely go again!

The restaurant is located in a strip shopping center. It is small and VERY loud ! If you can get pass the location and the noise this restaurant is WONDERFUL. The dÃ©cor inside is warm, the service is excellent and the food BETTER than excellent. The price is reasonable and the menu has something for everyone.
Wear earplugs and haven an enjoyable evening !

This unassuming restaurant, located in a strip mall in Willow Grove, serves up surprisingly good fare. A recent visit made everyone in the family rave. The crab cakes (topped with a mango sauce) were excellent; my daughter enjoyed her shrimp pad thai, and the chef was able to tone down one of the spicier dishes for my parents. We will return. Plenty of options (including vegetarian), reasonable prices and great service.

The menu looked very interesting and the place was full when the 6 of us entered the restaurant. The appetizers were done nicely which included crispy calamari salad, the delicious golden bags stuffed with shrimp and crab, beef carpaccio, and a surprisingly delicious tofu dish. The atmosphere was a bit chaotic as the server had to come back and forth from our table taking our food orders. The problem began with ordering our entrees. I wanted the beef, shrimp, scallop wok and the server said this was excellent bit they were out of scallops and were using chicken instead. This is OK but at the same price? They were out of rib eye steaks at 7:30 pm..not good My pork chop was so badly overcooked and I ordered it medium rare. They were very apologetic and offered to quickly make me something else. They did give us a complimentary dessert. Two of us ordered the half duckling with apricot sauce which was thin and sparse, What was worse was that the duck was badly overcooked, not destroyed like my pork chop, but pretty dried out and tasteless. Perhaps the kitchen is better on a week night but tonight they were careless.

I hate to give this an outstanding review because the restaurant is small in size, and I don't want there to be a line for reservations. Haha. Buy it really is great. Interesting variety of menu items. Different from a regular restaurant. Portions are generous, and the quality is impeccable.

One of the best meals ever as I had the seafood medley in a Asian fusion curry and Esther had a fusion stir fry chicken. We split an order of delicious spring roles Everything fresh and properly seasoned. Wonderful service. We split an amazing tiramasu desert and the coffee was delicious. Not our first time and not our last when we come in from Central PA. Had enough to take home for another dinner. Great value .
Make a reservation! You will not be disappointed -- Don't forget - it's a BYOB - the staff is attentive and will steer you in the right direction --

I stumbled upon this restaurant recently and don't typically write reviews. This restaurant was so good that I had to make a contribution here. I absolutely loved it. Being as picky as I am, I couldn't find anything I didn't like. The food was absolutely amazing, service outstanding, and environment very clean and pleasant. Recommend this place to anyone who is looking for something different, with great and accommodating service, given the fact that there isn't much variety in the given area.
Great food with just the right amount of spices added. Especially love the soup. Lunch is a great value meal.

My wife and I went to Colonial Quy-Bau for a late lunch on a weekday, it happened to be the Chinese New Year so there were still some tables taken by families celebrating it. If one can summarize in one word CQB cuisine is tastiness and presentation with a creative touch (French, Asian). The ingredients are masterfully balanced to offer a spicy and ever changing range of flavors. We tried the chicken and mushroom soup in a lemongrass broth, spicy and exquisite. For entrees, we shared "Com Chien Bo Nuong", a vietnamese style bbq beef served over jasmine fried rice and and "Bun Dac Biet rice vermicelli with grilled bbq pork, pork pate, shrimp and vegetable spring rolls (really crispy). We liked the vermicelli dish better as it was served with lettuce, cucumbers, mints, crushed peanuts and a fish sauce,which made it richer in texture and flavor. On the contrary, Com Chien Bo Nuong was a bit simplish and the bbk beef seemed gummy. For dessert, the limoncello cake was surprisingly good, not overtly rich (I usually don't eat desserts). Service was attentive and professional. Plates were reasonably priced and perfect size for a lunch meal. We'll go back.

We were on our way for a late lunch at White Elephant Thai (see my review) when it struck me that they are not open in late afternoon. They re-open at five for dinner. Serendipitously that very morning a friend told me about a good French/Vietnamese restaurant in Willow Grove. With a little help from MapQuest we made our way to yet another one of those unassuming spots in a strip shopping area. The space is handsomely appointed and tables are set with cloth napkins in bishopâ€™s miter, tall glasses and all necessary utensils including fine chop-sticks on a porcelain stand. The wait staff, a young man and young woman (curiously non-Asian) attended to is with all affability. As always, we ask them what they find the best dishes. From the appetizes we selected the rolls that are not fried (I never remember which are Spring and which Summer). From the entrÃ©es we chose the chicken in mango and from the bun B7. Bun Tom Nuong Cha-Gio Chay rice vermicelli with grilled marinated shrimp & crispy vegetable spring rolls. Each dish, beautifully presented, offered a very clean and tasteful experience. The only coming was the tiny bowl of rice that wouldnâ€™t feed a lark.
When the bill came it turned out to be $40 including tax and 20% tip for four people. You couldnâ€™t buy dinner at Wawa for that price.

Dined here on a saturday night, 4 people, 7:30 reservations- the place was packed to the brim. Its a small restaurant, so it was insanely loud- even the waitress was yelling the specials. Service was very good, the chef even came to the table to ask how we would like one of the pho options prepared. We all enjoyed our meals, and would possibly get take out, but it was way too loud that we wouldn't go back.

Tucked in a small strip shopping center, this French/Asian restaurant is excellent. Service is highly professional and the food is excellent. The appetizers, like the shrimp bags, are outstanding, and the main courses are uniformly memorable.

We found Imperial Quy-Bau by looking for high rated restaurants not too far from home. We had driven by this place for years and had never given it a second thought.
Inside, it is cozy, nicely decorated and although small, did not feel too cramped even when busy.
We had no idea what to order in this Thai French fusion menu, so we followed the suggestion of the waiter.
The food is delicious, obviously made from fresh ingredients and cooked to perfection. Although we usually do not order much fried food, we tried the golden bags which are just ridiculously good. We followed with the po - also incredible, and the barbecued beef. Just perfectly flavored and cooked.
The dishes range from $9 to $30 per main dish although most fall in the $12 range which is amazing considering the quality of the food
The restaurant is a BYOB which makes the bill even better!
It gets busy pretty quickly so dinner reservations are a good idea.
Pleasant ambiance and good service but not sending post cards. Duck is heated in a deep fat fryer. The place is nicer than the strip center it's in

Tried 3 different dishes, Pho Thailand, Pad Thai with Cashew, Rice with Chicken. All were good. The chef came out to offer us a special house made spicy sauce and asked if everything was good and if anything was required. The waiter was pleasant, caring and accomodative. Much Appreciate. A super bowl pho was split for 3 with extra meat and each plate came out excellent. Enjoyed our thai experience in Philly, Will return when back in town

An exquisite menu of Viet-Namese/Asian/french influence. Varied menu..something for everyone. You can easily make a meal with a couple of their unusual appetizers...don't miss the "little bags" and the puff pastary escarot. And... skip dessert and order the MUST HAVE Viet Namese coffee.
I've been to this restaurant three times and have thoroughly enjoyed my meal each and every time! The service is good too. I highly recommend this restaurant!

Having enjoyed multiple meal at Colonial Quy Bau, I can say with certainty that the food is excellent. I prefer to go for lunch, as the restaurant is quiet, and many of the same menu items are available. I cannot resist the iced Vietnamese coffee. Enjoy!
Interesting menu but with mediocre results..waitstaff seemed to disappear.... My suggestion would be to hire extra waitstaff and in the kitchen!

From the wonderful roasted pepper salad and escargot in a tasty puff pastry, to the practically fillerless crab cake and tender duck this Asian fusion restaurant in a strip mall is superb. The service was wonderful. The only thing that prevents me from giving it five stars is the noise level. 93 db peak which limits conversation, especially for the hearing challenged.

This place is AMAZING!! Literally anything on the menu is phenomenal. The owner is the chef who prepares all dishes meticulously,. The menu consists of Thai, Vietnamese and Asian fusion dishes and are all extremely delicious. This restaurant is one of our favorites in the area and is highly recommended. BTW, the wait staff is very good too. Overall a great experience throughout!!!

This was our first visit, after a friend recommended the restaurant. We were not disappointed! Soup, calamari, seafood special and soft shell crab entree with green curry sauce - it all delivered! Service was very good, very conscientious. We will be back!

You could easily miss the neighborhood gem which has a wonderful array of Asian and Asian Fusion foods. Anything on the menu is interesting, tasty, delicious and plentiful and the desserts are to die for. Wait staff is quite knowledgeable and will help you. I highly recommend the Thai coffee for desert...a real taste treat sensation
Super well prepared interesting Asian fusion food. Fresh well prepared and good value. Knowledgeable wait staff.

Had an early dinner here on a Sunday night. By 7 o'clock the place was pretty full. appetizers soup and main dishes were fantastic, beautifully presented, and well served.

Eugene, our server, knew the menu very well and was able to provide lots of detail as well as additions which we followed. Will dibe here again.

This was our first time at this highly recommended French Asian restaurant. At 8:00 pm the place was packed and we waited 20 min for a table, no big deal as it was a Sat night and we were waiting for our friends to join us.
My husband, who checked out the online menu prior to arrival, was looking forward to the puff pastry escargot, but they ran out of that. Our waiter recommended an app called Golden Bags instead- a mixture of shrimp & crab in a pastry bag tied with a scallion and quick fried with a sweet and spicy chile sauce which was excellent and enough to pass around and share. The waiter brought out 2 orders and placed them in front of the guys and after about 30 seconds, quickly came back and removed them, stating that a mistake has been made, those were for the next table! Lucky for them nobody sneezed on them or touched them!! We just laughed it off, but felt the waiter was a bit off his game.
About 5 minutes later, all of our apps were delivered and what we had was excellent! I tried the Thai chicken coconut soup with mushrooms and my friend had the grilled octopus salad. We enjoyed both. We all agreed to share a Bun bowl with BBQ pork, shrimp and rice noodles, served with a crisp spring roll, just to try a genuine Vietnamese offering. The meat was tasty but we felt it needed a sauce on the side since rice vermicelli was bland.
My Shrimp Pad Thai was truly the best I have had anywhere. My husband's Crispy Half Duck in blueberry chambord glaze was perfectly prepared. Our friends both had the Seafood Medley which is a little spicy for myself but they both loved it.
After reading about the lemoncelo marscapone cheese cake on these reviews, I was looking forward to trying it for dessert, but, alas, they ran out. Next time, I will order it first, since it is their most popular dessert - suggested by the staff. Our creme brÃ»lÃ©e was just perfect and coffee had a hint of cinnamon which I loved! Again though, another waiter foible, he took dish away without asking if we were finished...which I was not, there was half left! Felt as if he was rushing us to leave as it was after 10 pm, although there were still other diners there.
Although it is quite loud in there with a full crowd, I would highly recommend this restaurant to friends based on the food alone. I am more than happy to come back and give this another go. Next time we will come earlier to assure we get to try the dishes we want before they run out.

Three of us dined here for the first time this week. It was a rainy midweek dinner but the restaurant was busy. We were seated right away in a booth and the weather outside and the location in a shopping center were immediately forgotten. It is a very clean and attractive restaurant and the servers were excellent. They had many specials and I appreciated that the price was given as each one was recited. We enjoyed every dish and I especially enjoyed the beef potstickers. There were many things on the menu that I look forward to trying on our next visit.

Nice ambience, very friendly and accommodating staff, and the owner is wonderful! He made special vegetarian Pho for us....no meat, chicken, fish broth! He even made a special starter platter for us, which was delicious! We sat at the restaurant for about 2+ hrs and they were not in a rush for us to leave. We even had one of the best desserts....limoncello mascarpone cheese cake! Yummy!
Consistently good. The specials are always different and delicious. Nice dÃ©cor. A little noisy, but only because it is always so busy.

We read the reviews here for this wonderful Asian "Fusion" restaurant and we have to say... BRAVO to the chefs, owner, wait staff. Just the right amount of spice, just enough variety without being over or underwhelming. The food is cooked with fresh ingredients (you can tell) and is deeelish! And, being a BYOB, it's even more affordable! Our waiter was wonderfully attentive and this establishment is strives to make the experience relaxing and top-notch. Without going on and on.... we have to say - don't let the location sway you... it IS worth trying.... again and again.

lovely dÃ©cor, wonderful jazz, pristine surroundings, superb service with beautifully prepared Asian fusion cuisine
what a treat and the fact that it is a byo did not hurt in the least
hubby and I dined at lunch time and loved every morsel
very affordable
This restaurant provides all you need for an enjoyable evening or lunch. Food is outstanding, service is professional, atmosphere is good. All you need is BYOB and enjoy the greatness.

This was probably our fifth or sixth time at Colonial. The food continues to be fabulous, but the food service has declined. The place was full but that still does not justify a 45 min to an hour wait for appetizers. Other tables were experiencing the same delays. Note that this did not seem to be the fault of the servers, but rather a kitchen bottleneck.

This is one of those hidden gems that you pass in the nondescript strip mall every day until you stop in and realize -- wow, these folks know what they're doing. (So what are they doing HERE? Never mind, please don't go!) Everything we had was excellent, tasty and creative. Service was fine even though the place was crammed on a Saturday night. I recommend the green curry chicken, and the lemon marscapone cake is to die for.

This is my third time at the Colonial Quy-Bau and it is still absolutely fine. The service is very friendly and helpful. Food is excellent and well prepared . Always tastes fresh!
Great for a couple or for a small group. However, on the weekends it can be noisy. I would absolutely return.

This BYOB has been on the top of my restaurant list for years. Best dinner within 5 miles...and very very dependable. Rarely have I gone to eat here and not come away feeling deliciously full and feeling great about the food! It is great for a crowd, many different choices on the menu...and all excellent. Usually have a table free that you don't have to wait too long, but they do take reservations! Worth the money!

HEAVEN at an amazing food place...didn't even expect the service, based on location - just in the strip mall near me...TOTALLY blown away...each course is simple beautiful to look at, as it is presented, not just served...served just doesn't do justice to each dish...it is GIFTED to you...and delicious!~

I had the Duck Fried Rice and Escargot en Crute at this lovely BYOB. The Chef Corey and manager/owner trained at Susanna Foo and Corey also cooked at one of George Perrier's Bistro. Great price and quality, will do menu planning for Wine Dinners. I will be back.

Went to Colonial with my wife,13 yo son and a high school friend and his wife. Everything we all tried was fantastic. The fish was fresh with a great sauce, the pad tai was the best we ever had and the duck was delicious. We were surprised when the chocolate and lemoncello cakes were also good. BYOB helps with the reasonable cost of the meal. All and all a great meal.
This is the second time that I have dined here. The food is very good, and the prices are very reasonable. The Thai Spring Rolls are excellent! BYOB

The food was great, limited on the main menu but there were 3 specific menus I wasn't familiar with so I stuck to the main one.
The shrimp/ dumpling soup was just perfect.
The Golden Bags (wonton filled shrimp/crab) with tasty and flavorful, just enough sauce to make these terrific.
The crabcakes sandwich was amazing. My friend raved about her lunch as well.
Atmosphere, fabulous and chic.
Service, top notch for such a small place.
Decor - beautiful.
Parking - adequate considering it is a small strip mall.
Even the bathroom was gorgeous, lol!

Delicious! My wife said not to write the review, because then everyone would come here and they should. We had the Seafood sampler and the Portabello crabmeat special appetizers. Both were great. Chicken Pad Thai was awesome, as was the Duck with Pinapple Chutney. We don't usually get dessert, but it was going so well, we said "what the heck", and splurged on the Almond cream cake (sorta like Tiramisu). Service was excellent. This restaurant is in a little strip mall, but don't let that sway you. Inside is decorated very nicely and atmosphere was terrific.

Having eaten here many times with both family and friends,I have never had a bad meal.The place is lovely, and the service is very attentive. I have always eatten off the French side of the menu. I especially love the pineapple duck. They get very crowded on Saturdays, and the service is aliitle slower, I'm happier going during week,as I don't like crowds!!

I was in town for a convention with the president and his family of the company. My guest was hungry after a exhausting day. I looked up on yelp and trip advisor and was looking for a nice place to eat. I found a couple of places that was rated 4 to 5 stars.I didn't want to be embarrassed !!! My guest was in the mood for something unique. So i chose this place. Colonial Quy Bau. When we enter the restaurant. I and my guest was Amazed. First thing we noticed that it was well maintained. We was greet by a very pretty host. She sat us at the upper window level. As we were getting comfortable a server approached us immediately. He explained to us the different types of menu ( French Asian and The Vietnamese Menu ) and the specials of the evening. He was very knowledgeable and kind and recommended us with a couple of different samplers. I was blown away !!!! As the nite progressed each course was fresh and delicious. From the time we enter to the time we left it was the best dining experience. My boss and family was very happy. I would no doubt recommend this restaurant to anyone and not be embarrassed.

My wife and I continuously search for the next best Pho place, we stumbled upon this quaint place while getting lost out in Willow Grove. My wife being Vegetarian struggles to find places to eat Pho, while I am always on the lookout for a place with good beefball pho. Well...we found it. This is our new #1 choice, albeit, about a 35 minute drive for us, both times we have gone we have been extremely happy. The service is great, ambiance is quiet yet hip, prices are great (only been for lunch so far), overall excellent. You may think, ahhh well you haven't had every pho how can you judge? Yes, Pho taste is subjective, but this is the real deal. I have been all over NY, and Philadelphia, and this is by far the tastiest broth I have found.

We called around 4;30 for a 6:30 reservation for my wife and I and our 2 kids (12&15). Online menu looked great and food did not disappoint! We were seated upon arrival at 6:25. Only complaint is that waitress suggested a side of fried rice. Plate cost $9 and we barely touched it because the entries all came with rice, vegetables or noodles. Creme Brulee dessert was excellent. Trying to get out of the restaurant was a nightmare as a huge crowd was waiting to be seated and there is very little room for people to wait. I'm sure it was because it was New year's Eve and not an everyday occurrence. Which also meant it was probably unusually loud as well.
This BYOB never fails. The servers are knowledgeable and the food is fresh and very tasty. The luncheon menu needs to be tried next.
My family love going here not only do the have Pho but they also have great other selection of fusion french. BYOB is also a plus!

Food was delicious, but we all felt that the waiter was somewhat abrupt. Plus, we ordered 5 appetizers and only got 4. In fact, my wife specifically said, "that makes 5 appetizers" when we ordered. Anyone can have a bad day, so I'd go back.

The Asian fusion menu is diverse, with something for everyone. If you like seafood, meats, light, fried, Pho, vegetarian, gluten free...whatever, you'll find something to love. Our friend (who has eaten Pho around the world) said the homemade broth Pho was the best she'd ever had. Portions are generous and beautiful. The staff is well-trained and overseen by a professional manager who trained with the best. Corey, the owner and chef makes his rounds during the evening and will stop to talk without being intrusive. He will share his experiences cooking in some of the top Philadelphia restaurants. You can tell this is his passion. The atmosphere is relaxed but attractive. BYOB. If there is a weak spot it would be desserts, which do not rise to the standard of the rest of the menu. We will be back again and again.
Service was very good. I had the pastry escargot appetizer and seafood meledy.Both were very good. It us a BYOB so consider that in your planning.

Great gem right off of Rt 611 in a small strip shopping center. Wait staff was super attentive.
Sean our waiter was very informative on the specials and provided super service, we went with his recommendations and were very pleased with a calamari mango salad which we shared, fantastic soup, salmon and veal chop for our entrees. It is a BYOB. Fair prices. Comfortable, nice dining area. Very clean.This is now one of our favorite places. Good location off of Rt 611, Rt 63 and turnpike. Open about a 1.5 years. Not sure why we have not made it here before. We give out only an excellent rating if deserved.

Tried this surprisingly delicious restaurant based on the raves of another couple during a birthday dinner at Blue Sage. What a pleasant find! The food options vary between French and Thai or Vietnamese. The waitstaff is efficient, extremely polite and attentive. That alone is worth the trip back, but the food was the star at this BYOB in Willow Grove, just a stone's throw from the mall or the Abington hospital.

The duck entree was excellent and the soft shelled crabs with green curry equally yummy. Even the fried rice (an a la carte) extra was worth ordering. The fish special (salmon with crab, a delicate potato side) was demolished by its recipient. Portions are generous and tastes are rich. No one in our table of 5 diners was disappointed.

We'll be back. As this spot is popular, would suggest reservations are it is a small spot in an in an unassuming strip mall.

My wonderful son took leave from the Air Force and flew cross country to take me to dinner for my birthday. I had heard wonderful things about this restaurant so I was delighted when he suggested it. The menu was extensive and varied. The "specials" were also very interesting and could be done with your choice of fish (Salmon, Mahi mahi, Tuna or Tilapia) The quality of food was impressive. The only downside? was we did not know it was a BYOB so we had no wine with dinner. I am taking a dear friend there tonight to celebrate her birthday and will not forget the wine. The desserts were awesome and my Chocolate Mousse arrived on a dish that was decorated with a handwritten "Happy Birthday" in a delightful Raspberry sauce.

Comfortable dining atmosphere with dim lighting and minimal decor. The professional wait staff offered so many specials to choose from. I went with a spicy shrimp entree which I liked very much. Plenty of vegetables on the plate along with large shrimp in a mildly spiced sauce. For dessert I ordered the Limoncello cake with mascapone. It was so light with a wonder lemon flavor I was scraping the fork against the plate to get all of it. The bill for two people came to $59.83. Next time I will not order the sparkling water for $6 a bottle however I will order the cake again and I will frequent this restaurant very often.

Apparently this restaurant has been open for about a year and a half, but I went there for the first time yesterday. Was seriously impressed with the quality of all the food we ordered (4 of us). Fried calamari appetizer and "purses" were great. Calamari was not greasy at all, and no tentacles in the portion. Seafood medley, drunken noodles with chicken and shrimp, and the fish special (tuna) were our entrees, and they were all generous portions and flavorful. Only complaint is I asked for 3 out of 4 spicy level on my entree and it was still totally bland (waiter did bring me chili paste to fix that). Lemon cake for dessert was light and flavorful. Prices were very reasonable given the high quality of food and portions size. Plenty of other items sounded wonderful, so we will definitely be going back. Noise level a bit much, but place was packed. Give it a try, if you have not been there.

We just stopped in for dinner and the food was good but the staff is disorganized. While we ordered correctly, the server even read it back, everything was wrong. They even came out at one point with the wrong food.
I had the crispy chicken and there was absolutely nothing crispy about it.

If you want to venture out to this place, really really make sure they know that you are ordering.

Face it. I am a picky, difficult-to-please traveller and restaurant-goer. Read my reviews. I'm reminded that in Anna Karenina, Tolstoy wrote: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." Still... I look. Colonial Quy Bau is close to it. I first went here months ago, thinking it was a classic (and standard Vietnamese fare restaurant). It wasn't... And because I went there expecting it to be so, I was disappointed. I went back tonight... after reading their menu and adjusting my expectations to French - Asian mix cuisine. Our meal was truly fantastic. Everything was fresh as fresh can be. Prepared to darn-near perfection. Staff was so helpful and friendly. The owner spoke with us repeatedly. The Manager too. Decor is comforting and warm-chic. Clean. Comfortable. I will become a regular... And that is the greatest compliment anyone can give a restaurant.

If you're out shopping in the area, this spot, located in a small strip center, is a great find!
We came one Friday evening and ended up having dinner. It was busy when we arrived around 8:30 pm or so.
By the way, it's a BYOB.
We ordered some appetizers and then dinner and everything we had was really great!
Parking is easy, right out front.
Good service, energetic noise level and good food.
We will come back to dine again and will bring friends!

This is my favorite restaurant in Willow Grove for dinner. The atmosphere is attractive and comfortable, the staff pleasant, the food amazing. The chef used to work at a 5 star restaurant in Philly. I've also heard his recipe for scalloped potatoes is a well-guarded secret, which i believe since i've never tasted better! Try the crispy duck. It's outstanding, (and with it comes the scalloped potatoes). My husband assures me that the other dishes are every bit as good as the crispy duck, but I can't try anything else because I ordered duck on our first visit, and have craved it ever since. I did have a special appetizer once, shu mai which was also out of this world. Tender, melt in your mouth, with a delicate shrimp flavor ...I could go on, but I won't.

The food is very reasonably priced for it's quality. The duck is about $21. It's BYOB

Also, the correct name of the restaurant is Colonial Quy Bau, not "Colonila"

I love this restaurant. The food is always cooked to perfection and the service is very good. Weekends are busy and reservations are highly recommended. There is take out service too. On the weekends the noise level is "energetic" The regular menu has lots of selections as well as specials your server will tell you about. I love the fact this is a BYOB.
The menu is Asian/French/Vietnamese.
We've been here a few times, the food is consistently good with an interesting twist. Good service. Byob
Been going here for ages, with family and friends. Even when ordering online the food tastes fantastic. I really love the bun cha and the bahn mi, both with chicken.

This place is a hidden gem in Leuven. Itâ€™s hidden behind several hip and trendy restaurants on the tiensestraat. It was recommended to me by a friend and I was positively surprised.

The dishes served here are very good and large. I ate here almost 10 times and never was dissatisfied with what I got. Everything is very reasonably priced especially for this part of Leuven. I am always surprised that people do not know of this place.

The staff is very polite as well.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone studying or visiting Leuven and who is in for Vietnamese food.

There is no, or at least not much, space to sit down and eat it on the spot. So it is mainly take away.

We ordered on Sunday evening via takeaway.
The order was prepared and ready to take away upon arrival. The lady in the restaurant was super friendly.
Food was of excellent quality and take-away boxes are reusable.
We'll come back for more :-)
Nice small place in the center of Leven, you can find a very good Vietnamese food! The price is cheap and the athmosphere is relaxed. Only the cook is not kind to customers. Recommended.
One of those great places where the food is delicious, fast and fair prices. I come here often and the place is always full - they've got all the vietnamese goods. Great taste and helpful people.
Ah! Quy is my favourite lunch spot in Leuven. I absolutely love their noodle soup! Really kind people also, I will definitely come back really soon!
Friendly staff, great cheap food and also food for vegans and healthy food. I love this place, I totally recommend!

This is a typical Asian fast food restaurant that serves fried rice, noodles, salads, sandwiches en noodle soup. The food is cheap, but the quality is good and the owners are real Vietnamese. The pho noodle soup I ordered was very savory. The interior is rather Spartan, but I didn't mind. After all, you come here for a quick bite to eat, not for an extensive meal. It was a bit chilly though, so I had to keep on my jacket.

Ah! Quy is my favourite place to go for food!

Not only they serve excellent, freshly prepared and quality food, but also the owner is super friendly and always smiling :D

I am a vegetarian so cannot speak for the dishes that contain meat, but Quy (the owner's name) makes really good vegan alternatives of the meat dishes and I love each and every of these! My carnivore friends are also very satisfied with their portions, so I guess those are good too ;)

Quality-price-customer service ratio = superb! Very student friendly - Highly recommend!

Thanks Quy!

We went there with a group of 6 girls. We had a delicious dinner. The baked noodles, The traditional Vietnamese Pho soup and tje Vietnamese salad were all excellent! Thank you! We will come back for sure! :)
Deliciously authentic and cheap Vietnamese meals, with a side dish of friendliness and helpfulness. Don't let the fact that they have pictures scare you!
Love the food there. Still keep the traditional flavour of Asian / Vietnamese food. Will come back soon

I'm Vietnamese and I'm student of KU Leuven university. I miss Vietnamese food badly after 3 years of studying abroad. Honestly, it's quite difficult to find Vietnamese restaurant in Leuven. Fortunately, now I can try a lot Vietnamese food at Ah! Quy. Thanks again for the owner and staff. The foods are very nice, for instance, Vietnamese sandwich (Banh Mi) with different flavor like beef, pork and chicken. And the famous noodle soup called PHO (Beef noodle soup). That's so amazing !

Congratulations to Ah! Quy. Finally, someone had the guts to open a new asian restaurant that is not a sushi place. Leuven needed this badly. Thanks again to the owner and staff to make this happen.
Ah! Quy serves Vietnamese buns (Banh mi), soups (Pho), salads and the like. I had the Banh Mi with roasted pork and it was to die for.
Crispy sandwich, tender pork, cillantro, (pcikled?) radishes and cucumber and finally a delicious sauce to bind it all together. Recipe, please?
I will definitely be visiting this place more often: bye bye "smos kaas hesp" on Friday!

Voor het geld was het eten ok
Er stond een lange rij maar we hoefden niet lang te wachten. Je moet hier vooral geen luxe verwachten.

Het was de eerste keer dat ik hier kwam. Zeer eenvoudige goedkope inrichting. De soep was lekker, goede bouillon, noedels waren al gekookt en werden opgewarmd. Vriendelijke man die bediende. Zelfs in de namiddag genoeg studenten die honger hadden. Advies aan het personeel: Wil aub de tafels afkuisen als iemand klaar is met eten, ik vond maar 1 propere tafel. Wil aub uw toilet goed poetsen.

Sinds Ah! Quy in 2017 de deuren opende, kan men ook in Leuven terecht voor eenvoudige Vietnamese gerechten. De menukaart bestaat uit belegde broodjes, soepen, salades en diverse schotels met gebakken noedels of rijst. Voor de warme gerechten kan de klant kiezen uit kip, varken, rund of het vegetarische tofu. Verschillende groenten en een huisgemaakte dressing naar voorkeur maken het bord compleet. De gerechten smaken lekker af, maar zijn relatief klein van portie. De democratische prijzen vormen een bijkomende troef, want voor minder dan 10 euro kan men bij Ah! Quy een lekkere en gezonde maaltijd nuttigen. De bediening verloopt ten slotte hartelijk en vlot.

Ah! Quy is op weekdagen geopend van 12 tot 15 uur en van 17u30 tot 20 uur. Op zaterdag kan men hier terecht van 12 tot 16 uur. Deze zaak geniet een grote populariteit bij studenten, hetgeen het vinden van een vrije plaats soms bemoeilijkt. Bij mooi weer is het fijn tafelen op het ruime terras, dat staat uitgestald op het verkeersarme Alfons Smetsplein.

Ik heb hier al enkele keren gegeten en je krijgt hier waar voor je geld, Ah! Quy is bij de goedkopere restaurants op het Alfons Smetsplein, je merkt dat hun doelgroep vooral studenten zijn. Redelijk autenthiek Aziatische smaken. Zeker een aanrader en bij de beste van Leuven qua smaken vind ik persoonlijk!

Ze zijn wel degelijk open, in tegenstelling tot wat de website zegt.

We zijn hier take-away Pho-Bo & Noodle-salade gaan halen. Prijs-kwaliteit een echte topper. Wij moeste normaal tot Brussel rijden als we zin hadden in authentieke, Vietnamese smaken, maar tegenwoordig komen we in Leuven dus ook aan onze trekken.

Wij komen hier zeker nog eens terug! (waarschijnlijk wekelijks)

Tip: de porties zijn niet super groot. Wanneer je Ã©cht grote honger hebt, neem dan gewoon 2 porties en zet de rest in de frigo voor de dag erna.

Direkt neben dem pentahotel versteckt sich dieser Geheimtipp. Mit nur wenigen Tischen bieten das Ah! Quy eine kleine Karte mit einer Hand voll typisch vietnamesischen Strassengerichten wie Bun Cha, Pho oder Sommerrollen - das ganze zum kleinen Preis. Die probierten Speisen haben uns dabei geschmacklich sehr an unseren Vietnamurlaub erinnert und sind deswegen auf jeden Fall authentisch, wenn auch nicht ganz so scharf wie in Saigon oder Hanoi. Als Alternative zu den doch gehobenen Preisen in vielen Restaurants kann man hier sehr gut eine Zwischenmahlzeit zu sich nehmen.

ChÃºng tÃ´i tháº¥y chuyáº¿n thÄƒm tiáº¿p theo nÃ y lÃ  má»™t tráº£i nghiá»‡m dá»… chá»‹u. Xin giá»›i thiá»‡u nhÃ  hÃ ng Kim Quy!

Eight of us decided at short notice to book a meal and we couldnâ€™t have been made more welcome. The landlord and landlady pulled out all the stops to give us a friendly welcome and a good meal. We havenâ€™t laughed so much in a long time with all the friendly banter!

We had 2 evening meals in this pub, whilst staying at the nearby Quy Mill Hotel. It's quite small, on both evenings the bar area was quite lively, but we went in the lounge/restaurant area that was very quiet and had our meals in peace. We had fish and chips, scampi and chips one evening, sweet potato and satay curry, and hunter's chicken the next, all well cooked and presented, very tasty. Nice friendly service, the ale was Timothy Taylor's Landlord and one called Pegasus.

Called in for lunch after visiting the local National Trust property. This is a proper unspoilt pub with great food and a cosy atmosphere. The chips were the best we've had for a very long time and great value for money.

Lovely village pub with a great pint of Timothy Taylor.
We popped in on a January Sunday afternoon and it was packed full of locals.
We were made to feel very welcome!

Staying in the village for a long weekend ate here on a Friday evening and really enjoyed everything. Friendly service, good food at very reasonable prices and a lovely warm fire on a cold December evening. Couldn't ask for anymore.

Visiting family locally and so pleased to meet the new landlady Kate. The pub is set in a small village surrounded by beautiful countryside just outside Cambridge.
Really friendly, lovely inviting atmosphere and to top it delicious home cooked food at affordable prices.
Called in at lunch time on our way back from visiting friends. What a lovely find, very friendly atmosphere the staff were attentive and helpful. The beer was great and the food even better.

What is the point of having a sign on the main road which makes you you come off it to go for lunch I need to find the place closed... certainly not a vote for the New Year and shall not be returning...

We were visiting friends in Cambridge area and came across this small local pub.
Very friendly atmosphere. Great beers. Went back and second night and had wine (excellent red wine). The proprietor, Matt, was great.
This place is not fancy, but we enjoyed it a great deal.

I've driven past this place so many times and finally, today we popped in for a post walk drink. I am so pleased we did. The pub was lovely. A real old school feel, bit with a good up to date selection of drinks and tasty sounding menu. There are pub games that seem to have disappeared from most pubs and a friendly atmosphere in the main bar. It's the kind of place you would want in your own village. If you have driven past it and never stopped like me, then give it a go, especially if you like your German lager served on a Stein!

Whilst the Pub:Restaurant gets good reviews our lunchtime experience was poor. We needed just toasted Caprese sandwiches and spicy Quesedilas as we were eating out in the evening. Our simple food took twice as long to arrive as fish and chips took to arrive for later arrivals. They had a minuscule amount of filling and very little taste. The Quesedilas were spice but also largely empty. Thankfully we live far enough away to have no reason to return

A few years back I used to come here for Sunday lunch. Last night (Thursday) i came with some mates for a few beers on a nice sunny evening cycle ride out of the city centre (25 mins: easy ride).

The White Swan was a welcoming pub. Now it's under new ownership and it's even better. A really welcome surprise. Beer (local breweries) was on great form. Landlord is very welcoming.

All in all a proper pub. Not a gastropub, not a restaurant with beer. A real pub with decent beer (and I think there's still food). Highly recommended and will definitely come back here soon!

We'd been for a visit to Anglesey Abbey and the cafe there was heaving, so we thought we'd try a local pub instead. This one was nearby so we we gave it a try.

On first turning up we thought it was closed and were a bit unsure about the parking situation. We went in the side door and initial impressions were "a local pub for local people!", so were a bit unsure. However we were quickly greeted by a friendly barmaid and shown the menu, though she told us it was only small and they'd run out of a couple of things.

We were hungry so thought we'd give it a go, and are so glad we did. We ordered the ciabatta pizzas which were absolutely delicious and presented really nicely. Took a little while to come out but you could see it was because they were freshly made, and we were happy having a drink anyway.

The drinks selection is great, lots of good ales and a large array of gins.

We could have quite easily just relaxed in the pub for the rest of the day. It has a very traditional feel which is lacking in so many pubs now, and I'd definitely return if I'm in the area again.

As their website says, it's probably "not for everyone", and if you prefer a chain pub and are a large group then it's maybe not for you. I was there with my wife and parents and it was spot on for us.

Popped in here before Anglesey abbey and would thoroughly recommend. We had to wait a little while for the food due to staffing issues. But it was definitely worth the wait. I had the fish and chips and this was huge and the chips were delicious. My girlfriend has the pizza and thoroughly enjoyed this. Very reasonable as meal and drinks came to Â£19.

We love this pub. We don't have the fortune of living in the village but we regularly drive out to it for a walk and visit to the Swan. It's friendly, relaxed and drinks are reasonably priced. We haven't eaten there yet but sure it's only a matter of time!

It is a local village pub it is fullof village hub welcomes passer s by afraid it no longers does food but still a nice pub we usually have to unscrew the landlords coffin just before dark but hey everyone has there faults lol

I am surprised by the positive reviews of this pub. We visited with our walking group of 24 people. We order at 9.30, go for our walk and return for lunch. We arrived back in good time at 12.15. We don't expect really speedy service being a large group, but this was awful. The serving of drinks was very much slower than we have experienced in most pubs. We then sat down for our food. This was the first problem. There were not enough seats in the bar area and we had to squash up together on the benches. It was most uncomfortable. There was another bigger room but it was in darkness and clearly not in use. There was a computer and papers on one of the tables in the bar area which put it out of use and looked messy. There was no cutlery or napkins on the tables so we got our own by searching in the other room. The whole place looked shabby and untidy and the cutlery was very old. The bar area was untidy with unwashed glasses.

The fried fish was unavailable as the order had not arrived (not their fault)but they only told our group this when individuals got drinks and paid before their meal rather than announce it to the group to allow for re ordering. My husband who was near the back of the queue, chose a burger because he was told it would be quick.

The food came out slowly, one bowl of soup at a time. After about 40 minutes my husband and I still hadn't been served and when we asked we were given a very curt "it's coming!" I eventually got my fish pie after about 45 minutes waiting and most of the group were nearly finished. It wasn't worth the wait. It was quite tasty but there was almost no fish in it, just a few tiny pieces. My husband was still waiting. Still no apology or information. When it finally came my husband complained about how long he had waited (an hour) for a burger. He got a very rude response saying 'This is not Macdonald's you know.' According to my husband the burger was average at best. Our group had all left by now. The cook did come back and give a grudging apology. "I was only given the order 15 minutes ago" he moaned. And yet there were only two staff -they clearly didn't communicate at all! Those who had soup said it was nice but not very warm. Others ordered ciabatta with caprese salad but it came with no ciabatta. They thought it wasn't worth complaining.

Clearly they didn't have the staff or the ability to deal with a large group. But we didn't surprise them, it had been booked some time ago. Their clear lack of interest in the pub or its customers was very disappointing.

I won't go back. I give it one star because apparently the chips were good!

This place is definitely worth a try
Friendly atmosphere and the staff are very pleasant. Meal in the bar was very good and the service was excellent
Would recommend to anyone

Nice pub obviously a well like local, we had sunday roast which was lovely and a good dish of vegetables. Dessert was apple and blackberry crumble with custard, very tasty. Good price for good food. Staff were friendly.

Went for lunch on a Friday lunchtime.
First impressions were disappointing after the reviews we had read on TA. The car park and rear entrance areas were untidy and scruffy. We went into the dining room and had to ask the waitress to remove 2 cardboard boxes from the table we were hoping to sit at. The bar area in the restaurant was also cluttered up with rubbish.
We ordered drinks and food which we found a bit pricey for just a basic pub and choice was a bit disappointing as well. Me and my father in law had the fish and chinos as nothing else appealed. The ladies had mushrooms and haloumi cheese which actually looked great.Fish was nice and tasted good although chips tasteless and only choice with it was ordinary peas (no mushy available as an option.).
Service was good but our main reason for the visit was to check the place out for a possible Sunday dinner booking but the untidiness made us change our mind and we went elsewhere instead.
