Called in on spec after a visit to Anglesey Abbey where we were greeted on arrival and told that the restaurant was full, but a table in the bar was free. I has decided what to eat before even being shown a menu as a couple at an adjacent table were tucking into thick slices of pink roast beef. My roast lunch exceeded expectations - the generously sliced beef was tasty and tender and flanked not only by a massive Yorkshire pudding and roast potatoes, but also by swede, parsnip, carrots and sweet potatoes, all seasoned and roasted, with a side dish of freshly steamed vegetables. Staff were attentive and friendly and delivered second to none service. Certainly the best pub food I have eaten in a long time and would not hesitate in recommending The White Swan for both quality and service.

What more could you want - the food really was outstanding and very reasonable given the quality - emphasis on fresh with neat twists - we had pork belly with a tasty mash, and battered fish which bore no resemblance to chip shop fare, the fish just melted in the mouth. Overall this is the best food I have had in the local area and we will be returning again soon even though we are from the other side of the county - in fact in the next one.

The White Swan is a tiny pub which has suffered from being tucked away in a small dormitory village and has changed hands a couple of times. The pub is minutes from the A1303 /A14 East Cambridge interchange if you know where to look but there aren't a lot of reasons to visit Quy

Outwardly the pub looks little different, but the new team have put a lot of effort into the menu and drinks range . Real ales included well kept Oakhams and Cannon beers and a farm bottled Normandy beer . We've been twice and eaten in restaurant and bar. Best restaurant dish - the shared sampler pudding plate , best bar dish the perfect home made burger. Usually the idea of a burger is far more satisfying than the reality.

I'd actually give the bar food a 5 and the restaurant a 4 because while Cambridge has plenty of fine dining restaurants, it's hard to find pub food that's more than just pleasant.

The White Swan is a traditional village real ale Free House which has recently changed ownership and is now being run by Gerry Skews and family. We went to dinner there on Good Friday and thought it was brilliant! Our host in the restaurant was Martin who provided a really excellent, friendly and attentive level of service without being overbearing. He was well-informed about all the food and drink on offer and went out of his way to ensure that one of our party, who is currently expecting, had all her questions answered with regards to the suitability of different items on the menu.

The food was all fresh, tasty and really well-prepared. We saved room for dessert and I can highly recommend the mixed assiette that we sampled on the night. We went for beer over wine with our meal (although there was a bottle of Italian red on offer that we will definitely be going back to try) and the Norman Gold was a real find â€“ brewed in Northern France by an English gent, they will be offering other bottled beers from the range in the near future. Also on the pumps were Woodfordeâ€™s Wherry, Oakhamâ€™s JHB, Adnams Southwold Bitter and another real ale whose name escapes me for now.

After a thoroughly enjoyable evening, we had a quick chat to Gerry, the owner, on our way out. He asked for our feedback and we suggested a few minor cosmetic changes. Gerry said that the team had decided to concentrate on getting the food and drink right first as the rest would follow. Theyâ€™re right of course and whatâ€™s more, theyâ€™re well on their way. Weâ€™d heartily recommend an evening in the White Swan (they do a bar menu too), even if it means we have to book further in advance next time!

We stayed at the Best western Mill up the road, but after checking the reviews on Tripadvisor, decided to eat here instead. We were glad that we did, as it was at least as good as the prvious reviews have said. The landlord and landlady, are most helpful, (giving us directions to the Cambridge Ultralase for the next day-don't go to Ultralase). The atmosphere is most welcoming, and the food is of gourmet standard. We had a quick chat with the Chef (Paul) who was a fantastic guy, with a weatlth of worldwide experience. Don't be put off by the average looking exterior of this Pub, go in and sample what they have to offer, you won't be disappointed. You also won't be ripped off as the prices are very reasonable for the standard of food and drink on offer.

Visited by chance and a really good meal; fresh food, an imaginative well cooked dish and friendly service. Tried a beer that was new to me and was delighted.
Decided to return with my wife to see if the White Swan was consistently good and it was - this place is a'find'. Only visit if you want good fresh food, well kept beer and a good welcome.
The friendliness and service were great, good knowledge of wines. Food was excellent, well presented and tasty.

Driving through looking for a pub lunch & found this place just off of main road. What a treat.
Beer was very good. With excellent choice.
Atmosphere warm an friendly.
Good service.
Pub was lovely and warm too on a chilly day.
Good choice of dishes. Some interesting specials.
We had pan fried sea bass( with black pudding, chorizo, potato wedges-this was delicious & cooked to perfection) & veggie dish (grilled aubergene,peppers, potato/leek rosti-superb).
Would definitely visit again.

Great food, with a lot of thought behind it, the deserts are massive and wonderful! I had a brilliant dining experience here and will be going back! The staff were attentive and friendly and the bar is well stocked with great variety!

Just like the other reviewer we found this unassuming place by accident. We were staying at a nearby hotel but didn't like the look of their very pricey menu, so ventured into the local village and found The White Swan. We had imaginative, restaurant-quality food in comfortable surroundings with friendly, efficient service. The wine list was also well put together and very reasonable. I would recommend The White Swan and will definitely go again if I am in the area.

We only found this family run pub by accident, in January, a couple of months after the present landlords took over. We'd turned off the A14 on our way home to go to another pub but it was closed and we had to go to Quy to turn round, stumbling on the White Swan in the process. Though it's nothing to look at from the outside, just another old fashioned local, we were hungry so gave it go. What a lucky break! It was so friendly, the menu so original and the food so good that we made a beeline when passing by again this month. The food was not simply as good - it was some of the finest we've had, certainly the best in any pub. We're both vegetarians. No problem. My Mille Feuille (a layered stack of peppers and aubergines with butternut squash puree, soft cheese, wilted spinach and roasted pine nuts, served on a vinegar, leek and potato rosti) was just sublime - one sensational wave of taste after another. And that was just a bar meal, priced at Â£7.85!!!! Julie had mushroom stuffed with Mozzarella, courgettes and cherry tomatoes with sweet potato croquettes on a watercress salad from the main menu at Â£9.50. Also fantastic. We met the chef on the way out and he spoke with such passion that you knew this was someone who loves his work. Again the service was very friendly. Though there were few people in the dining room the bar next door was packed and buzzing, the popularity of the Swan as a pub no doubt helped by the fact that it is independent from the major brewers so serves lot of guest beers - including some bottled beers from the landlady's brother, who has a brewery in Normandy. Apparently the Swan is packed for Sunday lunches when they do a nut roast they are particularly proud of (as well as the traditional roast,obviously).

Ate in the bar as opposed to the restaurant a couple of days ago. It was refreshing to see a veggie option that looked and tasted as though some thought had gone into it as opposed to the standard vegetable lasagne (reheated in a microwave) usually on offer. Thoroughly enjoyed every mouthful. The guys enjoyed the fact that the pub is a free house with a few different beers to choose from, they also enjoyed their steak pies. Prices very reasonable. If I didn't live so far away I would certainly be back.

Per chi visita San Gimignano ,e vuole provare una buona cucina locale (Toscana) questo ristorante e' il posto giusto.
Bruschette e primi piatti,favolosi,
Ottimo anche il vino (meno costoso).
QualitÃ ' prezzo buono, realmente soddisfatto...
Da provare....ci rivedremo.
If you are into noodles this restaurant offers great food and does that at the right price. The services is also really nice!
Shrimp curry was the best with the right amount of spices and herbs. This restaurant constantly improves its dishes.
This was a very nice experience. The service was very friendly. The food was completely to my expectation and tasted home-cooked and made from fresh ingredients. I'll try the noodles next time
Food is great and taste like home cooked. Service is good too. Will try to order Vietnamese dishes next time.

Very delicious and rich, value-for-money, Vietnamese style of hot-pot. What you get is more than enough for dinner and above all, it's healthy food as well as food is prepared in boiled water. We also appreciated the friendly service,

First of all, I have only ordered take-away food at Kim Quy. Even though the restaurant looks nice, it does not invite me to stay in.

The food however is very good and you have more than enough. The friendly owner, with such a nice smile, is an excellent chef. I would definitely recommend Kim Quy for take-away.

PS: take nr A3! Yummie
when there for dinner, oh wow, the location is very nice, the restaurant decor is really romantic, the food was delicious, will come back soon
A bit slow (there _was_ a 16 person table next to us, so no real big deal) , but the food was delicious! Very friendly staff, nice atmosphere. True recommendation in Kortrijk!
This is a good restaurant run by a friendly woman. The food is excellent and not cheap at all, the service is outstanding. Been there several times.

TrÃ¨s bon repas, dans un cadre simple mais agrÃ©able. Dame trÃ¨s gentille, soucieuse de faire plaisir. Nous avons eu une remarque Ã  faire, c'Ã©tait tout de suite corrigÃ©. Nous avons trÃ¨s bien mangÃ©. Merci

Via Deliveroo bestelde ik hapjes, sushi, noodles met scampi en rijst met kip.
Alles was heel lekker maar vooral de sushi was TOP TOP TOP!

Heb hier zaterdag laatstleden voor het eerst take away besteld (coronatijd !).
Heel lekker !! Ook vriendelijke uitbaters. Zal niet bij Ã©Ã©n keer blijven. Echt een aanrader.

Gaan hier al jaren vaak een hapje eten en ook nu was het eten wederom zeer lekker.
Ook voor vegetariÃ«rs worden er lekkere schotels geserveerd.
Vriendelijke en sympathieke bediening met zÃ©Ã©r lekkere authentieke Vietnamese keuken! Eten is prijs kwaliteit uitstekend. Eenvoudig maar zeer klassevolle inrichting.

We wouden het toch proberen na al de revieuws, het was een kalme avond.. maar de bediening? Lang wachten tegen we iets konden drinken, daarna een hapje het was nog niet op en het eten was er.. vriendelijk vonden we ze nu ook niet kijkt niet om naar de klanten.. bord was wel zeker mooi verzorgt maar helaas onze ding niet maar smaak verschilt natuurlijk , een beetje gemiste kans. Niet voor herhaalbaar vatbaar :)

Na reeds meerdere malen te hebben afgehaald, gisteren eens echt ter plekke gegeten, en eens wat genomen wat je niet in afhaal kan nemen: de Kim-qou fondue! Absolute aanrader, fondue in groentebouillon, met uitgebreid scala een kip, rund, vis, inktvis, krab, allerlei groenten die je naar believen in de bouillon laat garen. Volle smaken en absoluut vetarm!

Hele geslaagde avond!

Sobere inrichting van dit kleine restaurant maar heel vriendelijke bediening. Wij zijn onverwacht langsgegaan op zaterdagavond om 19u30 zonder reservatie en toch een plekje gekregen. Eerst aan de hoge tafeltjes achteraan maar konden dan verhuizen naar een aangenamer lager tafeltje.
Kaart is niet zo uitgebreid maar je kan kiezen tussen rijstgerechten, noedelgerechten, noedelsoepen en fondue (deze laatste was heel populair maar inderdaad een beetje onhandig als je met een grotere groep aan tafel zit). Lekkere voorgerechten met verschillende hapjes en lekkere noedelsoep met kip gegeten. Zeker een aanrader voor iemand die fan is van de oosterse keuken en eens nieuwe smaken wil proberen. Maar wel reserveren voor zaterdagavond !
Voor de eerste maal telefonisch besteld en onze maaltijd stond op tijd klaar om af te halen. Heerlijke smaken en vers bereid. Een echte aanrader...
Het is heerlijk om daar uit eten te gaan. Ik hou enorm van dit restaurant. Het is lekker en gezond. Mij zullen ze er nog vaak terugzien.

Het interieur werd onlangs vernieuwd, veel gezelliger nu. Altijd lekkere gerechten en grote hoeveelheden. Alles lijkt vers en is smaakvol. Vlotte bediening. Lekkere soep en hapjes. Elke bezoek was de moeite waard.
Heel lekker Vietnamees, hrel vriendelijke bediening en grote porties. Meestal krijgen we de pho bo niet op en nemen we de rest mee, dan kunnen we thuis nog eens van genieten...
Zeker een aanrader voor een snelle hap of een maaltijd in een leuke setting. Ontdek de magie van de Vietnamese keuken in dit gezellig plekje in het centrum van Kortrijk.

Hadden met 6 personen de fondue besteld.
Bij het voorgerecht kregen 2 van ons een bordje
waar de kipspiesjes ontbraken, terwijl de andere nog 10 min.
moesten wachten. De fondue zelf zag er allemaal vers uit, maar zeer
omslachtig om te eten daar het verwarmingstoestel en de fondueset
zeer hoog boven de tafel uitkwam. De bediening werd door een jong en
niet te ervaren persoon gedaan. Hadden de indruk dat er niet veel
moeite gedaan werd om het ons aangenaam te maken.
Door het vernieuwde interieur was het wel gezellig zitten, maar het toilet
zag er niet echt proper uit.
Voor een lunch mogelijks o.k. Maar om te gaan dineren met vrienden
geen echte aanrader.

eerste indruk: neutraal ingerichte maar nette zaak. Als je weinig tijd hebt, zijn er andere adressen. Zeer vriendelijk ontvangen, als je een avondje gezellig wil tafelen en je hebt wat tijd, dan kan je er hier van genieten: lekker gegeten voor een correcte prijs. Vietnamees maar zeer toegankelijke smaken.Voor de liefhebbers: eend (in verschillende variaties) is sterk aan te bevelen. Wens je een voorgerechtje te delen als aperitiefhapje dan kan dit perfect, of dessert delen, geen probleem. Omdat we mensen kennen met glutenallergie, even nagevraagd en zeer concrete antwoorden welke gerechten wel of niet, klonk echt betrouwbaar. Telefonisch reserveren is aan te bevelen (zaterdagavond om 20u werden geen extra klanten, die niet gereserveerd hadden, meer aangenomen).
Wij gingen op de middag gaan eten met enkele collega's. Voor de lunch betaal je slechts 12,50â‚¬ en heb je een voorgerechtje en een ruim-voldoende hoofdgerecht. Aanrader!

Op aanraden van Indonesische vriendin hierheen geweest met het gezin. Ligging is wat buiten centrum, vandaar door ons vroeger onbekend. Fris, goed geordend "westers"" interieur biedt plaats voor een max.30 personen. De bediening gebeurt iets traag afhankelijk van de bezetting in de keuken, maar uiterst vriendelijk en hulpvaardig. Soepen zijn geweldig en alles wordt bereid met verse groenten. De menukaarten zijn iets onhandig in gebruik. Ook de hoofdschotels zijn uiterst verzorgd en rijk van smaak. Keuze in dessert is wel langs de magere kant. Is ons echt heel goed meegevallen en we gaan zeker terug !
Sobere, smaakvolle inrichting, vriendelijke bediening en lekkere, eerlijke keuken. Aangename verrassing dus,we komen terug.
Lekkere Vietnamees, alles was vers en verzorgd. Voldoende gegeten en gedronken. Vriendelijke bediening en behulpzaam. Een aanrader.

Beetje uit het centrum, rechtover studentenhome van Vives. Kader is niet Oosters maar hedendaags, met vriendelijke gastvrouw. Wat op de tafel komt is echter des te Oosters. Knappe kaart met genoeg keuze, pikant is hier niet superpikant. Lekkere soepen, heerlijke keizerrollen en zalige nems.
Krokante eend is echt krokant.
Zijn hier al 20 jaar gevestigde waarde, maar we kenden het niet.
We komen zeker terug als we Kortrijk nog eens bezoeken.

heel lekkere keuken, allemaal verse bereidingen wij hadden als voorgerecht
carpacio en loempia's mooi geserveerd met garnituur.
als hoofdgerecht hadden wij gebakken eend met groenten en scampi in curry met groenten en rijst.
super vriendelijke bediening, overal heel proper en net, zelfs de keuken waar je kan binnen kijken.
en dit voor een schappelijke prijs, wij zijn favoriet en gaan zeker nog terug.
Authentieke Vietnamese keuken in een fris kader. De smaken zitten zeer goed en smaakt top! Uitstekende prijs/kwaliteit. Aanrader voor wie op het laatste moment nog een lekkere maaltijd zoekt!
Heerlijke maaltijd. Eenvoudige gerechten, maar super lekker klaar gemaakt. Perfecte prijs/kwaliteits verhouding.

vriendelijk, lekker, niet ver van huis... meer moet het niet zijn!

wij waren er al verschillende keren, dus klanten die terugkeren is de beste reclame.

meeneem is ook mogelijk.
Super lekker, oosters restaurantje, zowel de ontvangst als de gerechten zijn lekker en je hebt er meer dan genoeg. Prijs/kwaliteit een toppertje !
Heel lekker eten in een mooi interieur! Vriendelijk personeel!ik zou er zeker nog eens gaan eten. Ook mogelijk om af te halen, dus prima.

Zijn langs geweest voor de lunch. Een klein buffet. Word wel telkens terug aangevuld.
Het eten zelf vonden we niet speciaal. Hadden er meer van verwacht.
Fantastisch gegeten. We hebben de Vietnamese fondue genomen met twee. Meer dan voldoende e erg lekker.De witte huiswijn is ook uitstekend. Een aanrader.
Al 20-tal jaar klant hier en de kaart is al vaak veranderd waardoor dit de aanrader is voor deze keuken te Kortrijk, zeker als je er nog eens de supervriendelijke gastvrouw bijrekent

's Middags heerlijk gegeten in het prachtig vernieuwde restaurant.
De kaart heeft enkele nieuwe
nieuwe gerechten o.a. Pho.
Maaltijdsoep is heerlijk, dus kozen we met zijn allen voor Pho;
eentje met rund, eentje met krokante eend een eentje met zeevruchten. Mooie presentatie, en vooral fantastisch lekkere Pho( flinke portie!)! En met een vriendelijke en vlotte bediening.
Een echte aanrader voor wie houdt
van
de 'echte' Vietnamese keuken.

lekker eten, aangename gastvrouw. We kregen onze hoofdmaaltijd niet op en vroegen om het mee te krijgen en bestelden nog een paar soepen voor thuis, jammergenoeg is de rest van onze hoofdschotel met iemand anders meegegeven dus zonder naar huis met enkel een sorry! nu geniet anderen door ons betaald! geen herhaling meer!
Hier vind je de traditionele vietnamese keuken zoals de bazin ze van haar moeder geleerd heeft. Lekker eten met ruime porties, vriendelijke bediening.

Alhoewel het restaurant pas om 18u open gaat, was de gastvrouw zo vriendelijk ons een half uurtje vroeger te ontvangen. De gerechten waren bijzonder lekker en vers klaargemaakt. Een aanrader voor een redelijke prijs. Niet hip, maar wel lekker. Ongelofelijk dat blijkbaar nog maar weinig mensen de weg hiernaartoe gevonden hebben.

. . . . . .waren onze verwachtingen misschien te hoog !!! wij waren er met vrienden op een vrijdag voor de lunch , in buffetvorm - we waren aan de late kant (13u05) -er waren nog 3 gasten die reeds aan de koffie waren - - de vrouw was zeer vriendelijk bij het onthaal - we vroegen een fles wijn , die was nog maar ingeschonken en ze vroeg al direct om aan te schuiven voor het buffet !! we hadden zo het gevoel dat we rap moesten eten om daar zo rap mogelijk weg te zijn,het buffet was gepresenteerd in grootkeuken bakken ,de soep was lauw - het eten zal om 12u wel lekker geweest zijn maar had al te lang "verwarmd" geweest , bij de scampi's was het krokante korstje al zacht ,het vlees uitgedroogd en alles had warmer gekund - - we voelden ons geviseerd zo hebben we de koffie in het stad gaan drinken waar we meer op ons gemak zaten, neen . . .voor ons was het geen meerwaarde

typische keuken.fijn, vers en vriendelijke bediening. prachtig kader, lekkere fondu, prijs redelijk. wijn wel een beetje boven de normale prijs (weinig kennis van prijsklasse en dus zijn bepaalde wijnen hogere prijzen dan de arbeidsmarkt. Voor de rest een aanradder..

Lekker gegeten, we waren met z'n zessen op zondag na 6'en en het was lekker rustig. Het enige jammere was dat er niet meer was!

het restaurant zit naast een grote weg maar je hoort haast geen verkeer.

Altijd opnieuw een leuke ervaring. ZÃ©Ã©r lekker eten , echte smaakbommen maar nooit overdreven. Loan runt haar zaak met passie, kennis en gedrevenheid .Het kader is gewoontjes en de prijzen aan de stevige kant. Spijtig dat er niet meer stoofpotjes op de kaart staan. Ik ga zeker terug bij een volgend bezoek aan Kortrijk.

De Fondue van het huis,
Is een schotel waar je nadien steeds aan terug denkt.
je praat er over met vrienden achteraf.
Leuk om aan vrienden of zakenpartners voor te stellen.
Gezonde en lekkere ingrediÃ«nten.
Kortom schitterend.

Bedankt voor de service

Eric Meersman

Gezellig kleinschalig vietnamees restaurant. De vrouw deze huizes staat in de keuken en in de zaal. Tijdnes de week over de middag is er een gevarieerd buffet. Voor die prijs moet he niet twijfelen...

Toen we er binnenkwamen, rook het niet al te fris... een probleempje met de verluchting, denk ik... Het rook zowat naar een vol appartement aan de zee dat de hele dag in de zon gelegen heeft... een geur die spontaan in me opkwam... De bediening (van de jongen) is ietwat aan de brute, ruwe kant... Er speelt loungemuziek en in een Vietnamees restaurant wil ik eigenlijk wel wat Oosters horen... Ik bestelde de Palm (33 cl stond er op de kaart en op de rekening) en het is dan ook heel onhandig om die in een glas van l'achouffe uit te schenken waar het streepje van de 25 cl net niet bereikt wordt... toch een beetje bedrog. Er was ook geen rundvlees meer aanwezig wat ons niet gezegd werd tot na we het besteld hadden... vreemd, want zo laat was het nog niet (20u30) en het restaurant zag er ook niet uit alsof het heel die dag heel druk was geweest...Het eten zelf was heel lekker en zeker niet te prijzig... Een goede keuze dus, maar een ietwat gemiste kans... 3,5/5

er zijn zo'n 35 plaatsen en het restaurant zat vol op zaterdagavond. De kokkin staat alleen in de keuken en haar dochter dient op. Goede en vriendelijke bediening. We hadden het menu genomen en hebben 1,5 uur moeten wachten op ons soep, na 2,5h hadden we ons voorgerecht. We zijn er om 19:00 aangekomen en waren pas om 23:00 buiten. Wel Ã©Ã©n van de beste Thai's die ik gegeten heb, jammer van de erg lange wachttijden.

NhÆ°ng Ä‘á»‘i vá»›i báº¥t ká»³ ai bá»‹ dá»‹ á»©ng, báº¡n nÃªn gá»i Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i hoáº·c há»i hoáº·c cÃ³ má»™t thá»© tá»± Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t.
O melhor sorvete de Floriano. Qualidade de produtos e diversidade de sabores. Indico os milk shakes e a banana split. Boa localizaÃ§Ã£o.
os sorvete da quy sorweto sÃ£o bons, jÃ¡ comi melhores, mais tem alguns que sÃ£o deliciosos, principalmente os que vem com uma casquinha crocante branca por fora...
A Quy Sorwetto Floriano sempre traz os melhores sabores de sorvetes que jÃ¡ provei... sempre que vejo ponto de venda compro o meu e degusto com muito gosto !!!
O sabor do soverte deste estabelecimento Ã© muito bom e satisfatÃ³rio a qualquer paladar devido a variedade de sabor que ela oferece para os seus clientes.

Excellent staff and service. Food choice and quality very good. Good sized room and strong shower. Good gym equipment and cardio machines Cleaning needs more attention as dining table sticky and room fan very dusty.

Don't go there if you are not dining, or don't mind eating pizza out of a box, artificial milk caplets with your tea and unpalatable food to waste your money.
I have been sheilding for 1 year and decided to dine after restrictions were eased and the hotel dining was advertised as " open" gave a great option of the Outside Inn" restaurant. As a regular of Quy hotel restaurant, bar, afternoon tea and spa I expected at least to the normal standards of the hotel... as per website. To my dismay. Reservation website did not work, Sunday Lunch was informed on website, but horrifically came in a form of pulled pork soggy 'Wrap' !! Pulled pork ( but was stated a just pork) is pork cooked to death and is indigestable!
Server did not wear a mask thoughout the afternon.
I would have been better of in money and safer going to a pub beer garden or ate my lunch from a street food truck.
Should I be asked to return to dine there?
Good quality food well served by the staff who are very nice indeed, two menus to choose from cater for all requirements people may have , good value for the prices charged

Just spent a night at this lovely location whilst visiting my mother in law in Cambridge. Room very comfortable, bed great, plenty of hot water, husband used the pool twice during our short stay. Dinner was excellent , especially the seatrout cured in gin! Andrew our barman/waiter was very helpful, warm and welcoming. Will stay here again.

My first experience was potholes on the drive. The room Iâ€™d been allocated wasnâ€™t ready and I heard the magical â€˜upgradeâ€™ word. The room was okay, so I wondered what the other room was like. Bathroom small, towels had a strange smell as though lack of soap in cleaning.

Sleep quality was good. There was no noise from the corridors and little from outside.

All of the staff that I met were engaging and efficient. Breakfast met expectations. I had a look at the spa and it was okay, smallish pool. Why is every leisure centre a spa now?

Not much â€˜wowâ€™, sadly, in a crowded market. Nearly there.

We booked to stay at the Mill for 2 nights as a short break where we could relax and spend some quality time together. On the first night we ate in the bar and had a quiet evening relaxing, the room was small but just right for us, the facilities where good and bed comfortable. Parking was easy and check in simple, all staff where friendly and accommodating. Although the weather was cold it was nice to explore the outside areas and gardens and ate out in Cambridge that night, staff were happy to book taxis for us which made the experience much more simple. On our last day we booked a treatment in the onsite spa and made use of the pool, sauna, steam and jacuzzi after checking out. We booked a couples mud chamber which I would 100% recommend, it was a relaxing, calming experience that really rounded off our trip.

Very disappointing afternoon tea for a four star hotel. dry sandwiches and frozen products used for sweets. Items served were not as listed on menu, cheap doughnuts and eclairs. The surroundings are stunning and the service was ok, but otherwise very poor.

A friendly hotel set in the countryside together with an excellent spa. The restaurant was exceptionally good. One could also dine or have drinks and coffee on a terrace. The classic cream tes was to die for!

I was invited to a conference here and had high hopes because it is such a fantastic venue. Quite a few of us arrived before registration at 9.30 but the coffee couldn't be delivered before 9.30 which was the scheduled time- when it did arrive it was weak. Second and third batches were stronger once we had asked for it to be made that way. Buffet lunch was really disappointing - sandwiches which we weren't sure if it was beef or duck (no labels) and some cheese/or egg and some wedges. I am not sure the organiser would have asked for such a small selection but the quality really wasn't good for such a lovely venue

Popped in for lunch in the bar prior to our spa afternoon.
To start it was great. Had coffee, ordered sandwiches and all was well. Not sure why we were served well after another couple who came in after us and ordered after us, also having sandwiches.
Finished our meal and tried for 10 minutes to catch a waiters eye. There were only 4 table covers so really not busy. I wanted to take half my lunch home as I was not hungry and didn't want to carry it across the restaurant. In the end I picked it up in my hand and walked to the bar where we waited to ask for a box and to pay. Terrible service! Completely unacceptable in a quiet period with staff chatting in the back and ignoring customers.
stopped here today for a quick snack and drink. Food was great ,as were the staff. especially Alex and Georgia who made our all the more pleasurable

This has been a favourite for a good quality, fair priced lunch for a while now, however having visited for lunch very recently we were extremely disappointed.
We both had chicken Caesar salads which in the past have always been exceptionally good. But not this time: lettuce past itâ€™s sell by date, undercooked eggs, Parmesan so well hidden I didnâ€™t find it until the end, forgotten anchovies, and chicken (which admittedly was well cooked) plonked unceremoniously on the top. We were not impressed! Service, however, was very good, friendly and helpful so helped to appease us.

We had quite high hopes for the Quy Mill because of its reputation. Staff were efficient and friendly and coped well with two members being late and so delayed their starters.

The starters were excellent and were arguably the highlight of the meal. The roast potatoes were particularly disappointing- under cooked and not really roasted and the veg were slightly over cooked. The real mystery was a white substance between the ample turkey and gammon which we couldn't decide whether it was stuffing or wallpaper paste. When the plates were cleared, the waitress advised that they had told the chef this on numerous occasions. Such as shame because the produce was good quality, room and venue was lovely but wouldn't rush back.

This was a very disappointing experience and ruined a present I had bought my husband for our anniversary. Very little atmosphere and they refused to serve outside, even though it was a boiling hot day. Service was also very slow and the decor dated.

Appalling service, had to wait for ridiculous time for each mediocre course. Failed to ask all of our party for drinks order, spoiled what should have been a family birthday celebration. The waiter however was very nice. Will not be rushing back.

The staff were attentive, our waiter in particular was first class, and the food was delicious. We were even given a mini starter and a palate freshener after the main course for free which was a treat. However... my low score is attributed to the lack of ambiance in the dining room. The low level of lighting made the room gloomy with one tiny candles on each table - it was difficult to discern the lovely food on your plate. Four small tree decorations on the mantelpiece aside a poinsettia were the only nod toward Christmas. A fire in the grate would have gone someway to lift the mood as the room was also cold. It was different in other parts of the hotel. It seems all efforts were centered on the Party Night which was warm and festive. And there was no 'confectionery' with our coffee as mentioned on the menu. Our first team dinner at The Quy a few years ago was very successful on all counts.

The Afternon tea was delicious but the experience was spoilt because of inattentive staff .Things got off to a bad start when we asked for vegetarian sandwich fillings only to be brought a selection containing ham .
the pot of tea arrived 10 minutes before the food and once the food arrived we were abandoned. No one came and offered to re fill the teapot. We tried to catch the eye of a waiter but to no avail. Eventually we gave up. Sat for 45 mins waiting someone to come and clear table or even fetch the bill, but again we were ignored.
In the end we had to go indoors to find someone to actually take our money.. A disappointing experience which was a shame as the food was wonderful

The website said tge restaurant was full...but a quick call and a space was found :)
As always...staff were fabulous, food was first class and service was perfect. At no time were we rushed....it was simply perfect and made an 80th birthday meal really special.

We stayed here for 4 nights in a ground floor room in the converted stables. I was apprehensive about the restaurant having read some of the reviews. However, we did eat in the restaurant with friends and it was excellent food very well presented and tasty, excellent service and a lovely table by the patio door so was very pleased with how that went. Breakfast was excellent there is a buffet and the cooked breakfast you order and it is cooked freshly for you.

We also tried the bar food two evenings which was also very good, the staff are so friendly and welcoming thats a big plus for the hotel.
The hotel grounds are lovely, i would say it felt like a business hotel but it was very nice.

Worth noting: if you want to use the spa book ahead, i went over to book some treatments and they were fully booked, they managed to get me in for a 1 hour treatment but i was a bit disappointed i wasn't advised to book the treatments when i booked our room, which was several weeks earlier. The facial i did have was excellent though.

It is a short drive to Anglesey Abbey and Cambridge, so good base for touring the area.
Attended a wedding here recently, had a lovely afternoon tea served us. Especially impressed by the gluten free afternoon provided for my coeliac boyfriend. It was superb! Thank you xx

Great location, really nice setting just a shame the food did not match. Over priced mediocre food. Not surprised there was only three tables in use on a Saturday night. I have resolved myself to not trying The Mill anymore as I am consistently disappointed and always leave with the opinion "that was a lot of money for what we received".

Visited for my annual shoot dinner. Was really impressed. Situated in the Waterwheel Room the atmosphere was perfect. The staff were attentive and ultra efficient. The food for 18 people was lovely. I go to quite a few dinners in lots of venues and this was above average

Lovely hotel, friendly staff, undersized food portions in the restaurant on Sat night. Chef doesn't seem to know how to cook salmon; it was overcooked, dry and 'crispy skin' was inedible. Ordered coffee with homemade conffectionary as a dessert. Confectionary arrived without the coffee which we had to ask for. It arrived 15 minutes later. Cappucino was vile! Most of it froth and what little coffee there was tasted disgusting. I never complained on the night as I didn't want it to spoil what was otherwise a very pleasant evening. Just won't be returning.
Food is very good, large portions and freshly cooked. Staff are friendly and efficient. There was a slight wait for the food but to be expected at the weekend at lunch time.

Went here for afternoon tea to celebrate a birthday and would highly recommend this to anybody. We were a party of 8 and they provided us with a private room. The table had been decorated with 70th birthday confetti which was a lovely touch. I had not asked for this and can only think I must have mentioned it when I booked the table over a month ago. We arrived 45 minutes early but were immediately made to feel welcome and were provided with tea and coffee whilst we waited for the kitchen to start. Everything was delicious but I must especially mention the scones which were the best I have ever tasted (and I've definitely had my fair share). I will definitely be back!!

Myself and my boyfriend came here for our anniversary and had the most amazing time. We had an evening meal in the restaurant and I can't fault it. We then had breakfast the next day and decided we wanted to have it in our room instead of going to the restaurant and this just cost Â£5 extra - it was brought to us on a time of our choice. We then had a spa package booked and had a hot stone treatment that was absolutely amazing and the staff made us feel so comfortable and relaxed. Lastly. we had sparkling afternoon tea which was the best afternoon tea I've ever had. The whole experience was amazing and I would recommend it to anyone.

Hotel in lodge forms very different. ? Food awards. ? But missing details and knowledge training on service. ? Lots of management. ? Staff Joe on bar he is a hoot.good well done.young Ryan FandB manager. Nice young man.food ? It's good plus but needs a new horizon. ? Bread , rolls lacking ? Desserts in restaurant poor? In bar better ? But overall. ? Good experience. Thank you to all he staff

I visited Quy Mill Hotel with the members of my company and their partners for our annual Christmas party. In mid-December on a Saturday it was of course packed with similar gatherings. Iâ€™d guess there were hundreds of diners, although most of the groups like ours had their own private rooms so we could enjoy our privacy whilst still feeling part of a great big party. From the champagne reception, through the meal with all the Christmas trimmings, the Quy Mill treated us brilliantly. I heard no complaints at all. The service was kind and attentive, and most of us stayed the night in the comfortable rooms in the hotel.
Itâ€™s an easy place to find, with ample parking, so Iâ€™d recommend the venue to anyone trying to organise a similar event.

We chose Quy Mill to celebrate our 10th Anniversary due to its location - close enough to Cambridge yet far enough away from all the stresses of corporate city life. We were welcomed in the bar area with some fizzy and some light refreshments. We were ushered to our room were the starters were brought out quickly and quietly. Mains and desserts followed with the same efficiency, delivered by very friendly and helpful staff. One staff member went the extra mile to supply wines which we had inadvertently missed off our menu. Highly recommend Quy Mill for corporate or Christmas events.

This was a first time visit, my friends and I had high hopes as we had heard good things. First impression, people very friendly and helpful. We were early and waited in the bar area, it was quite un-atmospheric, felt a bit like sitting in a Next show room. The restaurant was much cosier, though small did not feel crowded. Service excellent, attentive without being obtrusive. The food came plated with the meat, yorkshire and potatoes. The veggies came separately for each person, half of mine were hot, the other half warm and went cold quickly - the serving dishes were hot but maybe the lukewarm items had been left too long waiting for the other bits to be added. Nice big dish of extra gravy also came. The dessert was delicious and we finished with coffee in the lounge. Jury is still out on whether or not we would go back!

The room was fine and the food when delivered was acceptable. The main issue with this hotel is the staff they are of course very courteous and well mannered. But their lack of direction and confusion can only be down to poor management.

The delays in service and attention in every occasion was poor and simple things like ordering meals or drinks was very long winded.

Knowing the prices we paid I have had 100% better service at a lower star establishment.
Coming here is always a wonderful time because you know the staff are first class as will be the food. Today did not disapppoint.....wonderful wonderful wonderful! And not overpriced.

It was my partner's Birthday. We stayed the weekend just gone & had a very enjoyable time. Having the spa facilities onsite was a big plus.
We stayed in an Executive Room 207 in the outer barn area. When we checked in the reception, staff were great informing us of where everything was. On arrival to the room we found it had been decorated & also a card put in for my partner which was a great little touch.
There was a wedding happening but this didn't effect our stay. We had a drink in the bar area before going through to dinner and the meal was of a very high standard. Breakfast the following morning was just as good with a wide variety of foods.
Getting to use the facilities after checkout was an added bonus for us too as we assumed once we checked out we wouldn't be able to use them but reception mentioned we can stay there all day if we liked.
Looking at other reviews I can agree our room was warm but having stayed at other hotels in the UK I can't recall many of them having air-con. The room had a celling fan and also a fan in the wardrobe.
Overall we had a lovely stay & the staff went out of there way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. We would definitely recommend to others and will be returning ourselves very soon.

Myself and my man were in need of a few days away. We booked into this hotel as it also has a spa. The spa was fab as was the restaurant.
The hotel has recently been refurbished so looks great but there is no noise insulation between the rooms or corridors so it was very difficult for us to sleep due to the noise. We were moved to different rooms but all were the same, and we left feeling exhausted :(
Due to the above I would not recommend this hotel.

It's a hotel, fashioned around an old water mill which is inside the building. It has a hotel feel, not an inn by any means, but it's a nice hotel with a swimming pool and spa and is well kept, apart from a gravelly old car park where, if it's raining, your car and shoes get covered in sandy mud. Great for business meetings, no doubt, and close to a motorway junction ( traffic can't be heard unless you're out in the garden ). I rate this place for what it is. Wddings and business meetings. It's well out of town for Cambridge visitors, maybe 15 mins drive, or more.

We had a family gathering and really enjoyed the afternoon cream tea. The staff were superb from start to finish and could not do enough for us. We had a slight issue with a couple of the scones being very cold in the centre, but they dealt with it without any fuss or bother and soon put it right with some lovely alternatives. The food overall was of a very high standard and we thought the price was very fair. My son loved running in the grounds. We will definitely be back and hope to stay in the hotel next time.

Stopped here for a couple of days for a visit to the area. Chose the hotel as it is out of the city, with parking, pool & spa, and was rated for food.
Dinner on Friday night was OK - when it arrived. We asked for a table for 2 at 7:30 but were advised "no availability" so we took a 7:45 slot. We arrived at the allotted time but it was not until gone 8.00 that we managed to get a drink and order. It then took the staff until 8:40 to bring the starter and after some prompting!
Next night, at 7:45 we ordered and had just about finished the starter and main course by 8:40 - a bizarre contrast. The wine list was adequate but very expensive Â£20-40+ a bottle
As there was a wedding on saturday, there was little availability in the Bar which was drowned out by noise anyway, and no availability for the Spa on either the Friday or Saturday.
The room was OK, but overly hot and noisy from the nearby A14 dual carriageway.
A pity really as we found Cambridge really nice and would recommend the open top City Bus tour for a starter to get to know the city.

My sister in law ate here recently - booking a table for a bar meal. I thought the prices were expensive for what was on offer on the menu. We both ordered bangers and mash - and that is just what arrived. A dish with mashed potato on the bottom of it and three sausages placed on the top of it. The very small amount of onion in red wine sauce was flavoursome but not enough to for the dish. I felt this was very expensive for such a basic dish.

The menu is quite good although a little pricy. There was a discount on the food with a Best Western Reward Diamond card on this visit and points but this has since finished and you pay the full expensive price.
The grounds of this hotel are very nice.

After our Spa treatment we each had a main course. The salmon and brown bread was OK (easy to prepare)
My chicken gougons were horrible, cold and heavy . Huge chunks of roasted sweet potato were delivered with it, the skin was left on but these great chunks were also cold and I had to scrape the sweet corn off the cob as it was too hard to manage otherwise.No one commented on most of it being left!
Whole food concept needs radical improvement and following my Christmas review nothing has improved...even worse!

Poor experience not happy as a special occasion for my 91 year old disabled mothers birthday.

visited with my mum (91) , daughter, granddaughter (5) and partner today. had booked on line offering a discounted rate.

Arrived and seated fine but service slow. Ten minutes before cups of tea offered. Tea then took a further ten mins to arrive. Waitress asked what sandwiches and scones we wanted from a choice of 4 fillings. I asked for the childrens version for my granddaughter which came with a cheese sandwich. We had two pots of tea before food arrived after 25 minutes. One of the scones was missing and one of the pots of cream was hard or frozen, this was replaced no problem. I had to ask for the cheese sandwich for my granddaughter as her plate had egg sandwiches on instead. These were bought to her no problem. There was no cream or jam with my granddaughters scone again I had to ask for it. There was no cutlery to eat the jelly pots served in shot glasses with so we had to ask. The sandwiches were not great some were hard and had little filling. I had to go to the desk to ask for the bill and pay. I was not give the online booking discount so had to point this out after my card payment was taken. A manager was called to work out the refund and refund my card the difference. I asked if we could have the cakes we had not eaten boxed up to take home and was told this would be sorted. I went back to the table to get my mum ready to leave and helped her in t he car. This took a good ten minutes. My daughter waited for the box to be bought over or the cakes prepared to take home. noobody came over or offered to do this. I went to the desk and waited but nobody came so we left as my mother was tired and wanted to get home. I had informed the hotel it was my mums birthday in advance but thye were obviously unaware on our arrival. I also informed the desk my mum felt unwell at the end adn we needed to leave but this made no difference. My mum has not left her house since christmas this was supposed to be a nice treat for her but unfortunately it did not feel special. The service was very poor which is a great shame. I do not feel this was worth the Â£78 charge especially as we were unable to take home all the uneaten food i had paid for.
Highly recommended for afternoon tea. Had a 21st birthday here in a private room. Cakes were delicious.
My partner and I decided to have lunch in the bar to check as to whether the food had improved. Unfortunately it hasn't but was very slow in arriving. Could not recommend it at all. Quite unpleasant.

We booked here for afternoon tea for eight people.

I contacted the hotel on a couple of occasions with requests concerning the choice of sandwiches and the fact that some of the party did not like cream and they couldn't have been more helpful. Everything was as requested.

I had ordered some flowers to be delivered and these were waiting on the table when we arrived.

The staff were very attentative, but not overly so, and we were able to enjoy a very relaxed afternoon.

The only negative was that as we were a large group our table was in a less attractive area. There were nicer areas, but I don't think you could have accommodated our group there, and where we were we had plenty of room.

Will definitely be going back again, hopefully when the weather is better and we can enjoy the gardens.

Booked for afternoon tea but no one at the time of booking said it would have to be a festive tea. So a bit of a shock to get there and be told that we couldn't have the normal tea which is what i had booked for. Bit of a let down for us as the tea consisted of orange and raisin scone, macaroon , mini Christmas pudding and mini mince pie with a gingerbread man and a wine jelly. However one of our party dislikes Christmas food.
We managed by giving her one of my sandwiches, someone gave her their macaroon and she picked out all the raisins from the scone.
It was a cold miserable day but there was no fire merrily burning and looking at the room we were in you would never have known it was nearly Christmas. Not festive at all.If you wanted the festive tea it was o.k But we were not advised that it was the only tea on offer.

I've been three times for Afternoon Tea at Quy Mill now. The first time was a great experience, the second time was very disappointing and the third time was better. Personally, there is
too much heavy, stodgy cake and not enough sandwiches. The service on the first trip was good, on the second poor and on the third better. I don't think I will be going back for a fourth visit it's good but not excellent.

I hadn't been here for a few years, but my husband has been for business meetings & thought it had improved, so we decided to go for lunch. I was impressed with the new (not sure how new), decor, it had a lovely clean crisp, modern feel to it.
We both had the sausage sandwich which comes with fries & was very good.
The staff were very friendly, helpful & cheerful. In fact the service was excellent.

Having been here before I expected a lovely Sunday dinner. So what a disappointment today was. Booked for 1.30, order taken at 2.00 to be told that roast beef was sold out.
However I had the pork which was very nice. Had the soup as a starter but the whole meal was cool and the veg over cooked. We were looking forward to our lunch but in future we might give this a miss, if it takes two hours to serve two courses you might as well eat at home.

Service was poor but I must say the waiter we had was very apologetic. The soup was colds it was sent back, ( this was taken off the bill) we had to ask for our bread. 3 of us had the chicken Â£17 for a breast of chicken on a bed of spinach very expensive, to top it all we were over charged Â£15 a head and it took half an hour to get the bill, I don't think I will be going there again in a hurry for lunch and this was a birthday lunch.

Went for lunch with 2 colleagues. One colleague ordered a starter and the rest of us just a main course. Having waited 20 minutes or so, no food had arrived, so we asked about the starter and were toled it would be out in a few minutes. It did arrive but a the same time as the main courses.

We said that was not good and that the starter should have been brought out separately and before the mains, but the staff didn't seem to care and just walked away.
I had fish and chips which should have been a safe option, but it was by far and away the worst fish and chips I have had. The batter was thick, undercooked and horrible and the fish was dry and grey. The whole lot was inedible.

A waitress asked how our food was and I said the fish is terrible and I cant eat it - she just walked away again!

One of my colleagues had a burger. He has had the burger there before and it had been good, but whilst this looked great he said it was tasteless, overcooked and the bun was too soft / soggy.

Overall the food and service has drastically gone downhill as this used to be a reliable place to go for a decent meal.

There used to be a clubby feel about the Quy Mill which made it different and it was a good destination. However it's been modernised and the character has gone. It's OK as a place to stop en route but it's no longer a destination.

Today I had the haddock of chips. The fish was OK but the batter could have been crisper. Strangely the brown sauce came in small jam pots and the one I got only had a spoonful in it. When I asked for a little more I got two more exactly the same. And the sauce itself was hardly HP; it lacked bite.

Service was fine, the wifi was easy to access and I was in and out quickly enough. Just a bit bland.

We recently ate on a weekday lunch and all opted for the set menu. The food was beautifully presented and tasted lovely. Service was very good however a little slow considering the bar/conservatory was only a third full. I would have given 5 stars because itâ€™s a beautiful setting and we all enjoyed our meals however nearly 2 hours for a lunch by some may be deemed excessive.

Had afternoon tea with Prossecco sitting in the beautiful grounds. Nice selection of sandwiches, ham & grain mustard, egg, salmon, cream cheese and cucumber. Choice of fruit scone or cheese scone and a very nice selection of cakes. Choice of tea or coffee and all served outside.
we had lunch prior to going the abbey and the food was first class. Service was excellent and we will come back again

I attended a party at the Quy Mill which was Â£22.50 per head for a "BBQ" set menu lunch. To say it was overpriced is a understatement. Effectively it was a burger and chicken kebab. There was coleslaw, potato salad, and some average side salad. And that was the story of the whole lunch.. decidedly average, if that. For Â£22.50 a head I would have expected something really special, but it really did look and feel like a buffet you could have picked up in Aldi for about Â£5 per head at the most.

There was not enough food for the party, and then a number of guests has to wait over 20 minutes for more food to be brought in, by which time everyone else had finished. On top of that, the chicken that WAS brought in was undercooked and had to be taken back. It was abysmal. Desert, was some unbelievably stodgy brownie. That was it. 1 option. and it really was tough as boots. One of the more elderly members of the party had to be helped to cut it.
Although the brownies did have some a few strawberries around they, but they were not properly de-stalked and had the greenary still on them- Not really what you expect from a "4*" Restaurant. On top of that, not a single person came into the room to clear plates between mains and desserts. So we all had to eat our dessert around all our plates from our main food.
Drinks are ridiculously expensive. I think the Rekorderlig cider was Â£6.75 a bottle. And I bought a beer and a small wine at Â£9.75 for two drinks.

It really was over-priced, basic food, badly prepared, terrible service and an utter disappointment. The only saving grace is the location which is beautiful and such a shame that the food was so so poor and basic. This is a harsh review, but it was expensive, a friends party and not four star.
Would I return? Never. I would rather cook my own.

A most enjoyable stay. The staff are extremely helpful and the public areas of the complex are lovely. The wifi did not work in our room but was fine in the public spaces. The grounds are attractive and peaceful. All aspects of the room were more than adequate.

Had a family meal and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.
Food lovely and the children's portion was willingly divided into two, for our toddlers. We never felt rushed and the eating areas are very secluded, which means that with young children you are not disturbing anyone else.
Would definitely recommend this place.
Facilities clean and there is hand cream!

Had an evening meal with friends, but the atmosphere was quite uncomfortable. It was all a bit formal for us and my main course wasnt as I ordered (I ordered chicken but got steak) so I ended up eating after my friends, however the food was lovely and the waiter very apologetic.

If you like formal dining then it's great but we like to be a little more relaxed so would eat in the bar area next time.

Met some friends here for a coffee in the bar which was nicely presented, it was a good location for a catch up. It is easy to get to from the A14 which is handy when coming from different locations so a useful meeting point.
Overall the hotel (and the gym) is quite nice, well kept and makes it comfortable for a visit.

Was given a Groupon voucher for an Afternoon Tea for two as a gift for my birthday and was really looking forward to taking up the offer. This meant it is was Â£16 rather than Â£32. So glad the person who bought it for me hadn't paid full price.
The Afternoon Tea consisted of 8 small sandwiches, 2 salmon - tasty, 2 ham & mustard - tasty, 2 egg - ok, 2 cheese & cucumber - bland. Two large fruit scones - warm and tasty, with 1 small pot of jam and 1 small pot of cream. Nice cream but not enough for two scones. 2 macaroons, 2 small chocolate cakes - nice but very rich, 2 tiny muffins - nice, 2 berry jellies- nice.
We had taken an extra person and had ordered them a Cream Tea Â£8, this was good value having 2 large scones, same sized pot of jam and pot of cream as the Afternoon Tea. Unfortunately, the teapot that came for 3 of us didn't really give us enough tea for more than the 1 small cup of tea each. No jug of top up hot water came with it and no one came to ask if everything was ok. Although having now read an earlier review I'm glad I didn't ask for a top up in case we got charged. Shame that such a minor point of not having enough tea could spoil such a nice occasion.
Basically, if you'd paid full price it would have cost an extra Â£24 to get the sandwiches and mini cakes etc - not worth it, just stick to the Cream Tea. I'm sure this compares in value to many other places that offer Afternoon Teas, however I expect to get a bit more for my money and I would only return if I had a discount voucher.
Other than that, it was a reasonably nice venue and would be lovely to sit outside in the summer.

Wifey spent a very pleasant afternoon at the Quy Mill taking tea with a friend. Couldn't praise the place high enough. Good choice of teas, sandwiches, scones and cakes. Nice cosy surroundings, attentive staff. Will recommend and return.

Needing somewhere in the area (on a day when the nearby Missing Sock was closed) we tried the Country Inn. Certainly not worth a detour and a very institutional feel throughout food not awful but not good either and expensive for what it was ,service was functional but no gleam to it-maybe they were all tired from the memorable teas?

I booked an afternoon tea here after seeing an offer on Facebook.
On arrival it seemed there had been an issue with our booking.
The hotel had booked us in for a party of 4 not for the 8 of us.
This was not a problem, they were very sincere and apologised and sat us whilst sorting out a bigger table.
They infact gave us our own private room which was a lovely gesture!
The Afternoon Tea itself was lovely. Food all very good quaility.
Scones were fresh and warm.
The cakes were all very lovely.
I've been to The Ritz and Claridges in London for Afternoon Tea and the quality of food was to the same level in my opinion.
The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and I shall look forward to returning here one day.
Hotel is in a great location to escape the city whilst only being a short drive away.
A very pleasent afternoon.

I have lived in the village of Quy for over 20 but have never eaten at the Quy mill hotel until today and the afternoon tea was amazing, Lovely three tier tray of cakes and sandwiches. The restaurant and bar has a very posh restaurant feel but the prices for food and drink are very reasonable. Staff were very attentive, could not do enough for you lovely afternoon and will definitely be back.
Food served to an exceptional standard with service to match. Not a single fault during over 9 individual sittings for food in a 3 day visit.

My husband and I enjoyed a relaxing spa afternoon and then walked to the restaurant for our afternoon tea - such a great selection - sandwiches, fresh scones (and a choice between cheese and fruit) and some delicious cakes, accompanied by plenty of a tea of our choice. We shall definitely go again......

My family came down from Worcestershire on my birthday, I was totally surprised and delighted of course. My OH had booked the restaurant at Quy Mill for Sunday lunch for all of us, including my granddaughters Abi 11 and Ellie 9, I was slightly concerned that maybe children wouldn't be that welcome, but I needn't have worried. We had a really lovely dining room all to ourselves, plenty of room for 6 of us. The staff were attentive without being overbearing, they took our drinks order and then supplied us with delicious breads, we all said afterwards that we wish they hadn't. The menu was good but obviously limited to Sunday lunch type things but did include a salmon dish that both granddaughters had as it's their favourite. All of the starters we had were good and I think between us we had them all and obviously as families do, we all had a taste, particularly recommend the salmon and goats cheese starters. The main courses were good too, especially the beef, I had the lamb but to be honest it was a little fatty and chewy so was slightly disappointed. There were loads of vegetable accompaniments which were all cooked to perfection, though unfortunately we didn't do them justice as we were all full to bursting by that time so most were sent back. Needless to say the granddaughters could manage dessert and both were nice. Overall, we were really happy with the food and service, all wish we hadn't eaten quite so much of the bread, really pleased that we had the room to ourselves, not that it would have bothered us but might have upset other diners as we all talk none stop and might have been a little loud but always good humoured. Unfortunately it was raining in the day we went so we couldn't spend time in the lovely gardens. Also, the toilets are really clean with nice soap and hand lotion. I always try to check the loo's whenever I go to eat anywhere, I think if their nice and clean I'm happy to eat there, if their not, we don't and leave as quickly as possible.

It was our first wedding anniversary and my husband accidentally booked a standard room as when he booked it receptionist forgot to give him a list of room types. Called back and we were told it is fully booked. Came to the hotel and been upgraded to superior room free of charge as it is our anniversary. Food was delicious and lovely. Well garnished and lived up to my expectations (which is quite impressive for a very meticulous person). I ordered a seared beef for a starter, I tried it but preferred if my meat was a bit more cooked so when the waiter asked us if everything was ok, he offered to have my meat cooked properly. We were given complimentary fish cakes with sweet chilli. Very helpful and they like to engage you to conversation to deal with any issues we have. Very friendly atmosphere. The biscuits and breakfast are amazing. The room was very spacious and very clean and tidy. and the bath is big for two average size people and it could turn into a jacuzzi which is fantastic! Spa and pool facilities are great. We had a complimentary muffin afterwards. Price wise is quite expensive but if you get a deal it is great plus we used our gourmet card from Lloyds Club and got 20 quid off. Overall experience is brilliant. Coming back next year with my baby :)
Excellent food and the service was very good.Great Atmosphere Good place to stay.Nice grounds to sit and relax in
Good location on edge of Cambridge. Good food and sports facilities. Lovely spot for a wedding - nice grounds

The sandwiches were amongst the best we've had in an afternoon tea. Often places fill sandwiches with mayonnaise, garlic and the like, but Quy Mill just uses good, honest, quality fillings.

It was very quiet when we went, which was probably down to the time of day, but it did mean that there was a lack of ambience.

We'd go again I think and would recommend it to others.

Such a shame we have had a very below average experience. Having been here for business meetings, we thought it would be a lovely setting for a birthday meal with our 3 year old son. Beautiful surroundings, lovely building, but the short staff, and below average food, and not even a child's options or cutlery left us incredibly disappointed. So much so, we wouldn't visit again. Which is a shame as this restaurant held a sentimental value from years ago. If you want below average food and below average service then I guess you'll be happy.

Could not believe we had to pay Â£5 90 for a second pot of tea as the one brought with our "Afternoon Tea" did not give us two small cups each. Wondered why no one came to see if every thing was ok. Had to go and ask for a refill then got charged for it. Nowhere else have we been asked to pay for more tea! Didn't even get hot water!

Dinner for four was excellent. The food was beautiful, great quality we enjoyed every course. The service was fantastic, felt very comfortable and relaxed. They thought of everything before we did! Thank you it was an unexpected treat.

New Years Eve table of 6. The restuarant was full but we had a round table and had plenty of room. The service along with the food was excellent. I had scallops, followed by beef and I could not fault them. They had 6 clean plates from all courses. A pleasant evening. We found all the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful.

Where to begin.,. Xmas do for work place, too many tables crammed into room, once in your seat you couldnt get out! Food was atrocious, small, luke warm, no where near enough veg, slice and half of meat, burnt yorkshire and charging Â£40 per head for this absolute rubbish, shame on you quy mill!!!! Drinks horrendously expensive..... and staff under so much pressure they didnt smile once.... first and last visit for us, oh and dont get deposit for ill people back..they keep it as if not catching you enough....

We stopped off for lunch on our journey to Manchester. We have been several times before and have never been disappointed. There is a good choice on the menu for all tastes and prices are reasonable and the staff helpful and very pleasant. My husband had a very nice sandwich which came with beautiful hand made chips and a salad garnish. As a vegetarian, my choices are always limited but I ordered the vegetable burger which came in a bun with chips and salad garnish as well. We had a fair wait but it was worth it. I expected a normal "veggie" burger but it was, in fact, a stack of char grilled vegetables with cheese (but not a lot) onion and tomato. Although a little difficult to eat it was fabulous!. Having said all that there was one slight downer. My husbands sandwich came on a slate - ok fair enough, but my vegetarian dish came on a wooden cutting block with a handle. So what? Well I just had to ask if there were different blocks for meat and vegetarian meals, as I am sure they must have them separated in their prep area, but would they think to carry this through to service? I did ask at reception and she did look at me as if I was bonkers, but assured me that she thought they probably did have separate blocks I am not convinced but will probably never know. My beautiful meal was slightly tainted by the thought that meat could have been on the same block ( and we all know how fussy EH are about meat and wood because of the cleaning aspect) My advice is that if you order the veggie burger and are a little picky about such things like me - ask for a china place. Enjoy!

Service was a little patchy and the menu quite frankly eccentric. There was very little that wasn't of the fried, burger type variety and a salad option, which sounded scrumptious, turned out to be small. 'The home made' bread most certainly wasn't in the David Cameron league and not even 'home made' unless you class putting part-baked bread into an oven for a little while. Come on guys, even busy Dave does more than that! Mind you, I couldn't tell you the price!

We went for Afternoon Tea at this hotel for my daughter's birthday and decided to try the "Man's Tea" for a change. It was lovely and very different from afternoon teas that we were used to. The food was delicious and the service was brilliant.

I needed a last minute place to accommodate a visitor and to give them a traditional afternoon tea experience , I rang ahead and the staff were very accommodating . The afternoon tea was lovely and my guest was extremely pleased . I had been to a wedding at Quy a couple of years previously and the food was excellent then also .

I stayed here for two nights to attend a family wedding. It was a great experience the staff were very efficient, polite and keen to make the wedding a truly fabulous experience. The bedrooms were lovely and the food was seriously good. The wedding breakfast was lovely, food was hot, beautifully tasty, very well presented and served.

It was our anniversary and also the day of Andy Murray's final at Wimbledon, when we visited the Millhouse Restaurant at the Cambridge Quy Mill Hotel and considering that the hotel boasts two AA-Rosettes, we were rather surprised to find it nearly empty.

Quite why, beggars belief! My wife and I enjoyed a very tasty Treacle Cured Salmon for starters and our son plumped for the Ham Hock Terrine - both were exceptionally good! Mains saw the others enjoy pan-fried cod with new potatoes, whilst I went for the traditional roast; lamb, it was this week. The fish was cooked to perfection and I have to say that my little lamb gave up its life most honourably, to provide one of the tastiest roast lamb dinners that I have eaten for many a long year. Vegetables (included) were copious and many went back to the kitchen untouched, so parsimony is not a feature of this eatery! Dessert saw my wife and I enjoying mint poached strawberries with a prosecco syllabub, whilst our son went for the chocolate brownie and home-made icecream (well, he is only 12!) Both were absolutely delectable.

The wine list is eminently affordable, with the most expensive offering locking in at Â£65 (in so many AA-rosetted restaurants, you can often find wine priced in the stratosphere) but here the list had been carefully thought through and most tastes would be satisfied... as it was summer, we went for the Italian Rose at a very good value Â£19 a bottle! My one quibble was that I almost had to beg to see the winelist... asking for it four times seemed a tad excessive!

I have to say, there are few restaurants where I can find a menu where not a single dish is unappealing, but this was the case here... if I were a glutton, I could easily have enjoyed every single item on the menu and this did rather make the choice difficult - but we all left well sated and pleasantly replete to listen to Andy Murray's triumph on Radio 5 Live in the car on the way home!

A perfect summer's Sunday lunch!

Where do I start. I have already written a review for the hotel (which was great) and I did not want the terrible "fine dining" experience we had at the restaurant to affect the very good rating that I gave it. The menu only has five starters and five mains for the first two courses so when we were told they had run out of scallops (which was on two, or 20%, of the courses) we should have gone somewhere else. Although the restaurant was fairly empty we were sat by the door on the smallest table in the room and subsequent couples who were seated were also seated around this door area, the reason for this I do not know, perhaps to make the place look busy on a friday night. I have to say that if a restaurant is trying to be fine dining then the staff should not be dressed the same as the bar and hotel staff in aprons and open shirts and a little bit of customer service training for these particular members of staff would not go amiss. The atmosphere in the restaurant was like a morgue, every single noise of the fork on plate or whisper of conversation between diners could be heard. There was some horrendous Jazz music for the first hour or so but this just stopped during the main course leaving our whispers as the only sounds. We were asked if we wanted any bread before the starters and we paused in making our decision only momentarily due to the fact that we did not want to fill ourselves too much, before the impatient waitress stated "it is complimentary you know!" My starter was distinctly average, a hot smoked salmon which tasted ok. My wife ordered the pumpkin soup with Baji and as the waiter placed the soup on the table just as he was about to walk away he said "oh yeah, we've run out of Baji's". No scallops and no baji's, things were getting worse but I was assured by the manager that the chef was saving the scallops for the accompaniment to the main which was a fillet of hallibut. Now I'm not usually pedantic but when the menu says scallops you expect more than one. Not in this case. I had one scallop, one prawn and a fillet of fish that was only slightly bigger than the scallop. The flavours again were average and certainly not worth the price. My wifes steak was okay, fairly lean, not the most tender in the world, but for Â£26 I would certainly have expected better. I did make an attempt to tell the waitress how disappointed I was but she found the story of the missing baji quite amusing. We couldn't take any more and left before the deserts. There have been some good reviews of this restaurant but we certainly did not have the best of experiences. I have eaten in many fine dining and michelin starred restaurants and this restaurant certainly does not compare with others of similar price or reputation. Won't be going back.

We had lunch here as a stop off on our long journey home. We had had a terrible experience in the hotel we had been staying in in Birmingham and were in desperate need of TLC, Quy Mill certainly delivered. Nothing was too much trouble for the helpful and polite staff and the food we ordered was excellent, and promptly served, despite our not having a reservation and there being a large party in one of the other rooms. The ambience was perfect - calm, quiet and relaxed and every room we went in was spotlessly clean. My meal - Gosts Cheese salad followed by risotto was, strangely, exactly the same as that offered as the vegetarian option at the wedding we had travelled north for, but what a difference! My husband had soup so lovely I wanted it as well, but he wouldn't share. His bubble and squeak, haddock and poached egg was, he says, heavenly and he didn't want it to finish. Even the bread, butter and oil with balsamic was delicious. If passing by we will go again. Thank you Quy Mill.

They very kindly gave us a room to ourselves for the pre wedding meal the night before. Several of us are vegetarian and were pleased that there were several options. The food was excellent and the staff very helpful.

This hotel is a perfect place to stay, lovely hotel within grounds and close to Cambridge. The only downside is the food, very a la carte and not very good value for money I would not recomend eating in this hotel.

A little disappointing booked superior room and did not live up to expectations, noise from above and running water from waste pipe that came down in corner of the room, food in restaurant very good as was service and indoor pool was lovely, no fridge in room was disappointing don't think we would book again

To find a good restaurant just outside Cambridge is not easy.
Good food, interesting rooms with bygones from the past on the walls and very pleasant location.

We had a lovely evening, but only because we were in no hurry.
We went for dinner & the food was very good, but the service was slow. We had a lovely, friendly waitress who really was trying her best (we actually felt sorry for her), but there clearly wasn't enough staff on duty, which wasn't her fault. Unless they were bringing us something, at times we almost felt like they had forgotten we were there.
The restaurant needs some music too.
We had both red & white wine between us and whilst the white wine was chilled, so was the red wine!! Apparently it had come straight out of the cellar which was cold - maybe some organising would have brought it up earlier as when another glass was requested from another bottle, this too was cold!
Its a shame as the food really was good.

Food was dreadful. I had ham and cheese ciabatta called ploughmans ciabatta. Chutney was soaked into the bread so I suspect had been sitting in the fridge prepared like that. Cheese was smoked but was so chilled was tasteless and my sandwich included the rind. The ciabatta was toasted on one underside only, the top part and the rest uncooked . It was served with no salad just slapped in ham and cheese with soggy chutney bread as the base. At a price of 7 quid, I don't think so. I asked them to take it away and was asked what was wrong. Staff did not seem surprised or seemed to care, just took it off the bill. Went bank holiday Monday, a lot of the lunch menu was not available eg the sausage baguette, crayfish sandwich, ham platter or smoked fish platter.y husbands beer was also served far too cold which spoilt the taste. We live locally, last time we had a disastrous meal there was a couple of years ago, nothing's changed

I got married here 2 years ago and went back last week. The food is still out of this world. The service is excellant. I personally enjoy the whiskey and cigar bar.

The food is a bit pricey but definitely worth a trip for the wonderfull gardens!!

I've eaten in the restaurant at this hotel twice this year and been pleasantly surprised both times. The food is excellently prepared and presented - an imaginative chef. He can do the fancy bits, but can also prepare a simple grilled steak exactly as I ordered it - a good piece of meat not mucked about with. I got two "pre-starters" (unordered) which was a nice touch.
Stay here for a cheaper Cambridge experience, and drive in. Eat at the Swan in down the road though.

Some work colleagues and myself were treated to a lunchtime meal here as new starters with the company by the CEO.

Service was friendly and plesent but the food was a little slow comming out and didn't come out at the same time. It was cooked beautifully however. Portions were a bit on the small size for the price paid however.

We had a plesent time and enjoyed the meal overall. Just the two small complaints which effected the value score for me. Other than that a very nice place to eat.
Il locale Ã¨ molto bello e caratteristico, molto british. Musica perfetta, atmosfera perfetta, staff cordiale e attento, buona scelta dal menÃ¹ e piatti deliziosi. Assolutamente da provare!

Lobster per kg. 2,950,000 VND = 150 USD ... Do these people think Danang is Nice or Cannes at the French Riviera hahaha ...

Even standard fish like Tabtim or Nile Tilapia they want 550,000 VND per kg. Totally ridiculous. Avoid this place at all cost !!!
